article:
George Young (swimmer)

George Young was a renowned Canadian swimmer who gained international recognition for his remarkable long-distance swimming achievements in the early 20th century. Born in 1910, Young rose to fame with his record-breaking swim across the Catalina Channel in 1927, a feat that cemented his status as one of the greatest long-distance swimmers of his era.

Early swimming achievements

Young's affinity for swimming began at an early age, and he quickly demonstrated a natural talent for the sport. Growing up in Hamilton, Ontario, he spent countless hours swimming in the local lakes and rivers, developing the endurance and technique that would serve him well in his later competitive career. As a teenager, Young began competing in local swimming events, where he consistently impressed spectators with his speed and agility in the water.

Catalina swim training

In 1926, Young set his sights on the ultimate long-distance swimming challenge: crossing the Catalina Channel, a 20.2-mile stretch of water separating Santa Catalina Island from the California mainland. To prepare for this daunting task, Young embarked on an intensive training program, honing his skills in the waters off Catalina Island. Under the guidance of experienced coaches and trainers, Young fine-tuned his technique, built up his endurance, and acclimated himself to the unique conditions of the channel.

Catalina channel swim

On August 15, 1927, Young took to the waters of the Catalina Channel, determined to make history. Swimming with the tides, he faced strong currents and choppy waves, but his rigorous training and mental toughness enabled him to persevere. As he approached the mainland, a large crowd gathered to witness the finish, cheering Young on as he emerged from the water, exhausted but triumphant. His record-breaking time of 15 hours and 44 minutes would stand for many years to come.

Swam with tides

Young's decision to swim with the tides proved instrumental in his success. By timing his swim to coincide with the changing tides, he was able to harness the natural currents to his advantage, conserving energy and making steady progress across the channel. This strategic approach demonstrated Young's deep understanding of the ocean's dynamics and his ability to adapt to challenging conditions.

Competition from Norman Ross

Young's achievement sparked a rivalry with Norman Ross, an Australian swimmer who had also set his sights on conquering the Catalina Channel. Ross, a formidable competitor, posed a significant challenge to Young's record, and the two swimmers engaged in a series of intense competitions, pushing each other to new heights. This rivalry drove Young to continue innovating and improving, ultimately solidifying his position as one of the world's top long-distance swimmers.

Public acclaim, with limited financial gain

Young's record-breaking swim across the Catalina Channel catapulted him to international fame, earning him widespread recognition and admiration. However, despite his newfound celebrity status, Young struggled to capitalize on his success financially. The sport of swimming was not yet lucrative, and Young's modest prize winnings and endorsement deals barely covered his expenses. Undeterred, Young continued to pursue his passion for swimming, driven by a deep love for the sport and a desire to push the boundaries of human endurance.

Inconsistent swimming career

Following his triumphant Catalina Channel swim, Young's career was marked by periods of inconsistency and mixed results. While he continued to compete at the highest level, he faced stiff competition from emerging talent and struggled to replicate his earlier successes.

1927, 21-Mile Lake Ontario swim

In 1927, Young attempted to swim 21 miles across Lake Ontario, a feat that would have cemented his status as one of the greatest long-distance swimmers of all time. Although he ultimately fell short of his goal, Young's effort demonstrated his unwavering commitment to the sport and his willingness to take on new challenges.

1928, 15-Mile Lake Ontario swim

A year later, Young returned to Lake Ontario, determined to conquer the 15-mile distance. This time, he succeeded, posting a respectable time and reaffirming his position as a leading long-distance swimmer.

Wins Sept 1928 Montreal to Repentigney Marathon

In September 1928, Young entered the prestigious Montreal to Repentigney Marathon, a grueling 15-mile swim in the St. Lawrence River. With his trademark determination and endurance, Young emerged victorious, claiming the top prize and bolstering his reputation as a force to be reckoned with in the swimming world.

1929, 15-mile Lake Ontario swim

In 1929, Young once again tackled the 15-mile Lake Ontario swim, this time posting an even faster time than in the previous year. This consistent improvement demonstrated Young's dedication to his training and his ongoing quest for excellence.

1930, 15-mile Lake Ontario swim

The following year, Young returned to Lake Ontario, where he repeated his 15-mile swim with ease. This string of successes underscored Young's status as a dominant force in long-distance swimming.

Wins 1931 Lake Ontario win

In 1931, Young claimed victory in the Lake Ontario swim, solidifying his position as one of the world's top long-distance swimmers. This triumph marked the culmination of years of hard work and perseverance, as Young continued to push the boundaries of human endurance.

Late swim career

As the years went by, Young gradually transitioned away from competitive swimming, focusing instead on coaching and mentoring the next generation of swimmers. Although he continued to participate in occasional exhibitions and charity events, Young's competitive career slowly drew to a close.

Swim retirement and marriage

Following his retirement from competitive swimming, Young married and settled into a quiet life outside the public eye. This new chapter in his life allowed him to focus on his personal relationships and pursue new interests, away from the pressures and demands of his earlier career.

Marriages

Young was married twice, first to a woman named Margaret, with whom he had two children, and later to a woman named Dorothy. Both marriages brought him happiness and fulfillment, as he built a loving family and established a stable home life.

Late professional life

In his later years, Young returned to the world of swimming, albeit in a different capacity. He worked as a swimming instructor and coach, sharing his expertise and experience with aspiring young swimmers. This new role allowed him to remain connected to the sport he loved, while also giving back to the community that had supported him throughout his career.

Honors

Throughout his career, Young received numerous accolades and honors for his achievements in the swimming world. These tributes recognized his remarkable contributions to the sport, as well as his enduring legacy as one of the greatest long-distance swimmers of all time.

Central Riverina Football League

The Central Riverina Football League (CRFL) is a regional Australian rules football competition based in the Riverina region of New South Wales. The league was formed in 1949 and has a rich history of providing competitive football to the local community. The CRFL consists of nine clubs, each representing a different town or region within the Riverina.

#History

The Central Riverina Football League was formed in 1949, following the amalgamation of several smaller competitions in the region. The league's early years were marked by a series of rivalries between the founding clubs, including Ariah Park-Mirrool, Barellan, and West Wyalong. Over the years, the league has undergone several changes, including the introduction of new clubs and the departure of others. Despite these changes, the CRFL has maintained its position as a premier football competition in the Riverina region.

##Early Years (1949-1969)

The CRFL's early years were marked by a series of dominant performances by Ariah Park-Mirrool, who won five premierships in the first decade of the league's existence. The 1950s and 1960s also saw the emergence of Barellan as a major force in the competition, with the club winning three premierships during this period.

##Expansion and Growth (1970-1999)

The 1970s and 1980s saw significant growth and expansion in the CRFL, with the introduction of new clubs and the construction of modern facilities. This period also saw the emergence of new rivalries, including the intense rivalry between Ariah Park-Mirrool and Barellan. The 1990s saw the CRFL undergo significant changes, including the introduction of a new finals system and the departure of several clubs.

##Modern Era (2000-Present)

The CRFL has continued to grow and evolve in the 21st century, with the introduction of new clubs and the construction of modern facilities. The league has also seen significant improvements in player development and coaching, with several CRFL players going on to compete at higher levels. article:
Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles (1987 TV series)

The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles is an American animated television series created by Kevin Eastman and Peter Laird. The show was produced by Fred Wolf and aired from December 10, 1987, to November 2, 1996. The series was a massive success and became a cultural phenomenon, spawning numerous spin-offs, movies, and merchandise.

# Series Overview

The Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles series follows the adventures of four anthropomorphic turtles, Leonardo, Michelangelo, Donatello, and Raphael, who live in the sewers of New York City. The turtles are trained in the art of ninjutsu by their sensei, Master Splinter, a wise and skilled rat. The turtles fight against evil forces, led by the villainous Shredder, who seeks to take over the city.

## Seasons 1–7

The first seven seasons of the show were produced by Fred Wolf and aired from 1987 to 1993. During this period, the show was known for its lighthearted and humorous tone, with a focus on action and adventure. The turtles faced various villains, including the Shredder, Krang, and the Foot Clan.

### Vacation in Europe

In the third season, the turtles embarked on a vacation to Europe, where they encountered new villains and allies. This storyline was notable for its cultural references and humorous take on European stereotypes.

## Seasons 8–10

The final three seasons of the show were produced by AniMagic and aired from 1994 to 1996. During this period, the show underwent significant changes, including new character designs and a darker tone. The turtles faced more complex villains, including the villainous Lord Simultaneous.

## Subsequent Works

The success of the 1987 TV series led to the creation of numerous spin-offs, including the animated series "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: The Next Mutation" and "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Back to the Sewer." The franchise also spawned several live-action movies, including the 1990 film "Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles" and its sequels.

# Characters

## Overview

2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup

The 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup is the 19th edition of the FIBA Basketball World Cup, the flagship international basketball competition of the International Basketball Federation (FIBA). The tournament is scheduled to take place from August 25 to September 10, 2023, in the Philippines, Japan, and Indonesia. It will be the first time that the tournament is hosted by multiple countries.

#Host selection

The bidding process for the 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup began in April 2016, and a total of four countries submitted their bids. The Philippines and Japan were announced as the winning bid on December 9, 2017, at the FIBA Congress in Mexico City.

##Voting results

The voting results were as follows:

* Philippines/Japan: 18 votes
* China: 9 votes
* Turkey: 6 votes
* Argentina/Uraguay: 1 vote

#Teams

A total of 32 teams will participate in the 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup. The qualification process for the tournament began in November 2021 and concluded in February 2023.

##Qualification

The qualification process consists of several stages. The first stage features teams competing in regional tournaments to earn a spot in the next stage. The second stage features teams competing in a home-and-away format, with the top teams advancing to the third stage. The third stage features teams competing in a final tournament to determine the last spots in the World Cup.

##Qualified teams

The following teams have qualified for the 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup:

* Angola
* Argentina
* Australia
* Brazil

* United States
* Venezuela

##Draw

The draw for the 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup took place on April 29, 2023, in Manila, Philippines. The teams were divided into eight groups of four teams each. The groups are as follows:

* Group A: Angola, Dominican Republic, Philippines, Italy
* Group B: South Sudan, Serbia, Puerto Rico, China
* Group C: United States, Jordan, Greece, New Zealand
* Group D: Lithuania, Australia, Germany, Finland
* Group E: Spain, Brazil, Canada, Côte d'Ivoire
* Group F: Slovenia, Venezuela, Iran, Croatia
* Group G: France, Argentina, Japan, Lebanon
* Group H: Poland, Mexico, Montenegro, Egypt

##Seeding

The teams were seeded based on their FIBA World Ranking. The top four teams in each group were seeded as follows:

* Pot 1: United States, Spain, Australia, Argentina
* Pot 2: Serbia, France, Lithuania, Greece
* Pot 3: Italy, China, Poland, Brazil
* Pot 4: Dominican Republic, Puerto Rico, New Zealand, Japan

##Squads

Each team is allowed to have a maximum of 12 players in their squad. The squads must be submitted to FIBA before the start of the tournament.

#Venues

The 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup will be played in six venues across the Philippines, Japan, and Indonesia.

##Indoor arenas

* Mall of Asia Arena (Pasay, Philippines)
* Araneta Coliseum (Quezon City, Philippines)
* Okinawa Arena (Okinawa, Japan)
* Indonesia Arena (Jakarta, Indonesia)
* Philippine Arena (Bocaue, Philippines)
* SM Mall of Asia Arena Annex (Pasay, Philippines)

##Training venues and hotels

The training venues and hotels for the teams will be located in the vicinity of the indoor arenas.

#Preparations

The preparations for the 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup began several years in advance.

##Turnover ceremony

The turnover ceremony took place on October 28, 2022, at the Mall of Asia Arena in Pasay, Philippines. The ceremony marked the official start of the preparations for the tournament.

##FIBA Basketball World Cup 2023 Board

The FIBA Basketball World Cup 2023 Board is responsible for overseeing the preparations for the tournament. The board consists of representatives from FIBA, the Philippine Basketball Federation, the Japanese Basketball Federation, and the Indonesian Basketball Federation.

##Governmental support

The government of the Philippines, Japan, and Indonesia have provided significant support for the tournament. The governments have allocated funds for the construction of new venues and the renovation of existing ones.

##Test events

Several test events were held in the lead-up to the tournament. The test events were used to test the venues, the equipment, and the staff.

##Volunteers program

A volunteers program was launched to recruit volunteers to help with the tournament. The volunteers will assist with various tasks, including crowd management, ticketing, and hospitality.

#Preparation games

Several preparation games were played in the lead-up to the tournament. The preparation games were used to help the teams prepare for the tournament and to test their strategies.

#Format

The 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup will feature a new format. The tournament will consist of several stages, including the group stage, the second round, and the final round.

#Officiating

The officiating for the 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup will be provided by FIBA.

##Referees

A total of 44 referees have been selected to officiate the tournament. The referees were selected based on their experience and their performance in previous tournaments.

#Opening ceremonies

The opening ceremonies for the 2023 FIBA Basketball World Cup took place on August 25, 2023, at the Mall of Asia Arena in Pasay, Philippines. The ceremonies featured performances by local artists and the lighting of the FIBA Basketball World Cup torch.

#First round

article:
Cocaine Bear

Cocaine Bear is a 2023 American black comedy thriller film directed by Elizabeth Banks, based on the true story of a bear that ingested a large quantity of cocaine in 1985. The film stars Keri Russell, O'Shea Jackson Jr., Christian Convery, and Alden Ehrenreich, and follows a group of individuals who must navigate the dangers of a cocaine-fueled bear in a small town in Tennessee.

# Plot

The film takes place in 1985, in a small town in Tennessee, where a group of individuals are brought together by a series of events involving a bear that has ingested a large quantity of cocaine. The bear, which has been roaming the woods, begins to wreak havoc on the town, causing destruction and terrorizing the residents.

The main characters, including a park ranger (Keri Russell), a narcotics officer (O'Shea Jackson Jr.), and a pair of bumbling thieves (Christian Convery and Alden Ehrenreich), must navigate the dangers of the bear and the corrupt individuals who are trying to exploit the situation for their own gain.

As the story unfolds, the characters must confront their own personal demons and work together to stop the bear and restore order to the town. Along the way, they encounter a range of colorful characters, including a eccentric local (Ray Liotta) and a group of hapless hunters.

# Cast

* Keri Russell as Colette Matthews
* O'Shea Jackson Jr. as Cartwright
* Christian Convery as Henry
* Alden Ehrenreich as Eddie
* Ray Liotta as Syd
* Isiah Whitlock Jr. as Reba
* Ayoola Smart as Olivia
* Jesse Tyler Ferguson as Sargent Bob

# Inspiration

The film is inspired by the true story of a bear that ingested a large quantity of cocaine in 1985. The bear, which was found dead in the woods of Tennessee, had ingested 70 pounds of cocaine, which had been dropped from a plane by a smuggler.

## Creative liberties

While the film is based on a true story, it takes significant creative liberties to enhance the narrative and characters. The film's director, Elizabeth Banks, has stated that she was drawn to the story because of its inherent absurdity and the opportunities it presented for satire and social commentary.

## Response to the film

The film has received a mixed response from audiences and critics, with some praising its originality and humor, while others have criticized its tone and pacing. The film's trailer, which was released in 2022, generated significant buzz and anticipation, with many viewers expressing excitement at the prospect of a film about a cocaine-fueled bear.

# Production

## Development and casting

The film was developed by Elizabeth Banks and her production company, Brownstone Productions. The script was written by Jimmy Warden, who is a newcomer to the film industry. The cast was assembled in 2022, with Keri Russell and O'Shea Jackson Jr. being the first to sign on.

## Filming

Filming took place in 2022, in a range of locations, including Tennessee and North Carolina. The film's cinematography was handled by John Guleserian, who has worked on a range of films, including "The Fault in Our Stars" and "A Quiet Place".

# Music

The film's score was composed by Mark Mothersbaugh, who is known for his work on a range of films, including "The Royal Tenenbaums" and "The Life Aquatic with Steve Zissou". The soundtrack features a range of songs, including "I'm Alive" by Sia and "Uptown Funk" by Mark Ronson ft. Bruno Mars.

# Release

## Theatrical

The film was released in theaters in February 2023, by Universal Pictures. The film was released in a range of formats, including IMAX and Dolby Cinema.

## Home media

The film was released on home media in May 2023, by Universal Pictures Home Entertainment. The film is available on a range of platforms, including DVD, Blu-ray, and digital download.

# Reception

## Box office

The film performed reasonably well at the box office, grossing over $50 million in its opening weekend. The film went on to gross over $200 million worldwide, making it a moderate commercial success.

## Critical response

The film received a mixed response from critics, with some praising its originality and humor, while others criticized its tone and pacing. The film holds a 52% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on 202 reviews, with an average rating of 5.5/10.

## Accolades

The film was nominated for a range of awards, including a Critics' Choice Movie Award for Best Comedy. The film's director, Elizabeth Banks, was also nominated for a range of awards, including a Directors Guild of America Award for Outstanding Directorial Achievement in Feature Film.

# Legacy

The film has been praised for its originality and humor, and has been credited with helping to revitalize the career of its director, Elizabeth Banks. The film's success has also led to a range of spin-offs and merchandise, including a range of toys and clothing.

article:
Acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk

The acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk is a significant corporate takeover that has garnered widespread attention and debate. The deal, which was finalized in October 2022, marked a major shift in the ownership and direction of the social media platform. This article provides an overview of the acquisition process, including the prelude, buyout offer, attempted termination, and eventual completion of the purchase.

# Prelude
## Background
Twitter, founded in 2006, had grown into a global social media platform with over 440 million monthly active users. Despite its popularity, the company had struggled to achieve profitability and faced increasing competition from other social media platforms. In 2022, Twitter's stock price had declined significantly, making it a potential target for acquisition.

## Early developments
In January 2022, Elon Musk, the CEO of SpaceX and Tesla, Inc., began purchasing Twitter shares, eventually acquiring a 9.2% stake in the company. Musk's investment in Twitter sparked speculation about his intentions, with some analysts suggesting that he might seek to acquire the company or push for changes in its leadership.

# Buyout offer
## Takeover bid
On April 14, 2022, Musk submitted a non-binding proposal to Twitter's board of directors, offering to acquire the company for $54.20 per share, valuing Twitter at approximately $43 billion. Musk stated that he wanted to take Twitter private to facilitate changes that would enhance the platform's value and promote free speech.

## Acquisition announcement
On April 25, 2022, Twitter's board of directors announced that it had accepted Musk's offer, subject to shareholder approval and regulatory clearance. The deal was expected to close by the end of 2022.

# Attempted termination
## Alleged hold
In May 2022, Musk announced that the acquisition was on hold due to concerns about the number of fake accounts on Twitter. Musk claimed that Twitter had underestimated the prevalence of spam accounts, which he believed could have a significant impact on the company's valuation.

## Attempted withdrawal by Musk
On July 8, 2022, Musk notified Twitter that he intended to terminate the acquisition agreement, citing the company's alleged failure to provide adequate information about spam accounts. Twitter's board of directors responded by stating that it would take legal action to enforce the agreement.

# Revival and closing
## Revitalization of bid
In October 2022, Musk reversed his decision to terminate the acquisition, announcing that he would proceed with the purchase of Twitter at the original price of $54.20 per share. The deal was expected to close by the end of October 2022.

## Completion of purchase
On October 27, 2022, Musk completed the acquisition of Twitter, taking the company private. Musk immediately began implementing changes, including the dismissal of Twitter's CEO, Parag Agrawal, and other top executives.

## Post-acquisition
Following the acquisition, Musk announced plans to reform Twitter's content moderation policies and reduce the platform's reliance on advertising revenue. Musk also stated that he would consider reinstating banned accounts, including that of former U.S. President Donald Trump.

# Reactions
## Takeover bid
The announcement of Musk's takeover bid was met with a mixed reaction from investors, analysts, and Twitter users. Some investors expressed concerns about the potential risks associated with Musk's ownership, while others saw the deal as an opportunity for Twitter to grow and innovate.

## Acquisition announcement
The acceptance of Musk's offer by Twitter's board of directors was widely reported, with many outlets speculating about the potential implications of the deal.

## Attempted termination
Musk's decision to put the acquisition on hold due to concerns about spam accounts was met with skepticism by some analysts, who questioned the validity of his claims.

## Completion of purchase
The completion of the acquisition was widely reported, with many outlets analyzing the potential consequences of Musk's ownership for Twitter and its users.

# Critical analysis
## Takeover bid and acquisition announcement
Musk's takeover bid and the subsequent acquisition announcement sparked a debate about the potential benefits and risks of his ownership. Some analysts argued that Musk's leadership could bring much-needed innovation and growth to Twitter, while others expressed concerns about the potential risks associated with his ownership, including the possibility of increased polarization and decreased transparency.

## Attempted termination
Musk's decision to put the acquisition on hold due to concerns about spam accounts was criticized by some analysts, who argued that his claims were overstated and that the issue was not a significant concern.

## Revitalization of bid
Musk's decision to revive the acquisition bid was seen by some analysts as a strategic move to negotiate a better deal, while others argued that it was a genuine attempt to acquire the company.

## Completion of purchase
The completion of the acquisition was seen by many analysts as a significant development in the history of Twitter, with potential implications for the platform's future direction and growth.

# Legacy
The acquisition of Twitter by Elon Musk is likely to have a lasting impact on the social media landscape. The deal has already sparked a debate about the potential benefits and risks of Musk's ownership, and its consequences will likely be felt for years to come.

article:
Velma (TV series)

Velma is an American adult animated mystery comedy-drama television series created by Charlie Grandy for HBO Max. The show is a spin-off of the popular Scooby-Doo franchise and serves as a prequel to the original series, focusing on the character of Velma Dinkley. The series premiered on January 12, 2023, on HBO Max.

# Plot

The series follows the story of Velma Dinkley, a brilliant and introverted high school student who becomes embroiled in a series of mysterious events in her hometown of Coolsville, Ohio. As Velma navigates her relationships with her friends and family, she must also contend with a complex web of secrets and lies that threaten to upend her life.

Throughout the series, Velma must use her exceptional intelligence and analytical skills to unravel the mysteries that surround her, often finding herself at odds with the authorities and other adults who are determined to keep the truth hidden. Along the way, she must also confront her own personal demons and learn to trust herself and those around her.

# Voice cast

## Main

* Mindy Kaling as Velma Dinkley
* Glenn Howerton as Fred Jones
* Sam Richardson as Shaggy Rogers
* Constance Zimmer as Daphne Blake
* Russell Peters as Norville "Shaggy" Rogers Sr.

## Supporting

* Nicole Byer as Linda
* Sarah Chalke as Carol
* Chris Geere as George
* Tony Hale as Sheriff Stone
* Wanda Sykes as Donna

# Episodes

## Series overview

The first season of Velma premiered on January 12, 2023, and consisted of 10 episodes. The second season is currently in production and is set to premiere in 2024.

## Season 1 (2023)

1. "The New Kid"
Velma starts at a new school and quickly becomes embroiled in a mystery involving a missing student.
2. "The Secret's Out"
Velma's detective skills are put to the test when she discovers a dark secret about her family's past.
3. "The Sleepover"
Velma and her friends attend a sleepover at Daphne's house, but things quickly take a turn when they discover a mysterious artifact.
4. "The Party"
Velma attends a party at Fred's house, but things get out of hand when a guest goes missing.
5. "The Game"
Velma becomes obsessed with a new video game, but she soon realizes that it may be more than just a game.
6. "The Ghost"
Velma and her friends investigate a haunted house, but they soon discover that the truth is far more sinister.
7. "The Prank"
Velma's detective skills are put to the test when she discovers that a series of pranks at school may be more than just harmless fun.
8. "The Family"
Velma's family is put in the spotlight when her parents are accused of being involved in a mysterious crime.
9. "The Evidence"
Velma discovers a piece of evidence that could solve the mystery of the missing student, but she soon realizes that it may be more than she can handle.
10. "The Truth"
Velma finally uncovers the truth behind the mystery of the missing student, but she soon realizes that it may have far-reaching consequences.

## Season 2 (2024)

The second season of Velma is currently in production and is set to premiere in 2024. The season will consist of 10 episodes and will continue to follow Velma as she navigates her relationships and solves mysteries in her hometown of Coolsville, Ohio.

## Special (2024)

A special episode of Velma is set to premiere in 2024. The episode will be a holiday-themed special and will feature Velma and her friends investigating a mystery at a holiday party.

# Production

Velma is produced by Warner Bros. Animation and is executive produced by Charlie Grandy, Mindy Kaling, and Howard Klein. The series is animated by Titmouse, Inc.

# Release

Velma premiered on January 12, 2023, on HBO Max. The series is available to stream on the HBO Max website and app.

# Reception

## Critical response

Velma has received positive reviews from critics, with many praising the show's unique take on the Scooby-Doo franchise and Mindy Kaling's voice acting as Velma. The show has a 82% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, with many critics praising the show's clever writing and engaging mysteries.

## Audience response

Velma has also received positive reviews from audiences, with many fans praising the show's take on the Scooby-Doo franchise and the chemistry between the characters. The show has a 4.5-star rating on IMDB and has been trending on social media since its premiere.

## In popular culture

Velma has been referenced in popular culture since its premiere, with many fans and critics praising the show's unique take on the Scooby-Doo franchise. The show has been referenced in articles and podcasts, and has been trending on social media since its premiere.

article:
Boris Johnson
================

Alexander Boris de Pfeffel Johnson is a British politician who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Leader of the Conservative Party from 2019 to 2022. He previously served as Mayor of London from 2008 to 2016 and Member of Parliament (MP) for Henley from 2001 to 2008 and for Uxbridge and South Ruislip from 2015 to present.

Early life and education
-------------------------

### Childhood

Boris Johnson was born on June 19, 1964, in New York City, United States, to British parents Stanley Johnson and Charlotte Johnson Wahl. His father was a British diplomat who was working for the United Nations at the time of his birth. Johnson has three siblings, including journalist Rachel Johnson and politician Jo Johnson.

The Johnson family moved to England when Boris was five years old and settled in Primrose Hill, London. He was educated at a local state school, Primrose Hill Primary School, before being sent to a preparatory school, Ashdown House, in East Sussex.

### Eton and Oxford: 1977–1987

Johnson won a scholarship to Eton College, where he was a King's Scholar and served as the captain of the school's rugby team. He was also a member of the school's debating society and was known for his wit and oratory skills.

After completing his A-levels, Johnson went on to study Classics at Balliol College, Oxford. At Oxford, he was a member of the Bullingdon Club, an exclusive dining club known for its wealthy and aristocratic members. He also served as the president of the Oxford Union, a debating society that has produced many notable politicians.

Early career
-------------

### The Times and The Daily Telegraph: 1987–1994

Johnson graduated from Oxford in 1987 and began his career in journalism. He worked as a trainee reporter for The Times, but was sacked after just a few months for fabricating a quote. He then moved to The Daily Telegraph, where he worked as a correspondent in Brussels, covering the European Union.

### Political columnist: 1994–1999

Johnson returned to London in 1994 and became a political columnist for The Daily Telegraph. He also began writing for The Spectator, a conservative magazine, and became known for his witty and humorous writing style.

### The Spectator and MP for Henley: 1999–2008

#### Becoming an MP

Johnson was elected as the Member of Parliament for Henley in 2001, succeeding Michael Heseltine. He served as a member of the Conservative Party's frontbench, serving as the Shadow Minister for the Arts.

#### Second term

Johnson was re-elected in 2005 and continued to serve as a member of the frontbench. He also became known for his appearances on television, including a memorable appearance on the comedy show "Have I Got News for You."

Mayor of London (2008–2016)
---------------------------

### Mayoral election: 2007–2008

Johnson announced his candidacy for Mayor of London in 2007 and went on to win the election in 2008, defeating incumbent Ken Livingstone.

### First term: 2008–2012

#### Policies

Johnson's first term as Mayor was marked by a number of high-profile policies, including the introduction of the "Boris bike" scheme, which allowed Londoners to rent bicycles for short periods of time. He also oversaw the development of the Olympic Park in East London, which was built for the 2012 Summer Olympics.

#### Relations with the police, finance, and the media

Johnson's relationship with the Metropolitan Police Service was strained during his first term, particularly during the 2011 London riots. He was also criticized for his handling of the city's finances, including a decision to scrap the Western Extension of the Congestion Charge Zone.

#### Re-election campaign

Johnson was re-elected as Mayor in 2012, defeating Labour candidate Ken Livingstone.

### Second term: 2012–2016

Johnson's second term as Mayor was marked by a number of controversies, including a row over the Garden Bridge, a proposed pedestrian bridge over the Thames. He also faced criticism for his handling of the city's housing crisis.

Return to Parliament
---------------------

### Brexit campaign: 2015–2016

Johnson played a key role in the 2016 Brexit referendum, serving as the leader of the Leave campaign. He was a prominent figure in the campaign, appearing on television and at rallies across the country.

### Foreign Secretary: 2016–2018

Johnson was appointed as Foreign Secretary by Prime Minister Theresa May in 2016. He served in the role for two years, during which time he was criticized for his handling of a number of high-profile issues, including the Salisbury poisoning.

### Return to the backbenches: 2018–2019

#### Journalism

Johnson returned to journalism in 2018, writing a weekly column for The Daily Telegraph.

#### 2019 Conservative Party leadership election

Johnson announced his candidacy for the Conservative Party leadership in 2019, following the resignation of Theresa May. He went on to win the election, becoming the new leader of the party and Prime Minister of the United Kingdom.

Premiership (2019–2022)
-------------------------

### First term (July–December 2019)

#### Brexit policy

Johnson's first term as Prime Minister was dominated by the issue of Brexit. He negotiated a new withdrawal agreement with the European Union and won a general election in December 2019, increasing the Conservative Party's majority in Parliament.

#### First Cabinet

Johnson's first Cabinet was marked by a number of high-profile appointments, including the appointment of Sajid Javid as Chancellor of the Exchequer.

#### Loss of working majority

Johnson lost his working majority in Parliament in September 2019, after a number of Conservative MPs defected to the Liberal Democrats.

#### 2019 general election

Johnson called a general election in December 2019, which the Conservative Party won with an increased majority.

### Second term (December 2019 – September 2022)

#### Second Cabinet

Johnson's second Cabinet was marked by a number of changes, including the appointment of Rishi Sunak as Chancellor of the Exchequer.

#### COVID-19 pandemic

Johnson's government responded to the COVID-19 pandemic with a number of measures, including the introduction of lockdowns and the rollout of vaccines.

#### Immigration

Johnson's government introduced a number of changes to the UK's immigration system, including the introduction of a points-based system.

#### Legislative agenda

Johnson's government introduced a number of high-profile bills, including the Environment Bill and the Nationality and Borders Bill.

#### 2021 Downing Street refurbishment controversy

Johnson faced criticism in 2021 over the refurbishment of Downing Street, which was funded by a Conservative Party donor.

#### Owen Paterson controversy

Johnson faced criticism in 2021 over the handling of a controversy surrounding Conservative MP Owen Paterson, who was found to have breached lobbying rules.

#### Partygate scandal

Johnson faced criticism in 2022 over parties held in Downing Street during the COVID-19 pandemic, which were found to have breached lockdown rules.

#### Starmer slur controversy

Johnson faced criticism in 2022 over a slur he made against Labour leader Keir Starmer, which was widely condemned.

#### Vote of confidence

Johnson faced a vote of confidence in June 2022, which he won but with a significant number of Conservative MPs voting against him.

#### June 2022 by-elections

The Conservative Party lost two by-elections in June 2022, which were seen as a significant blow to Johnson's leadership.

#### Pincher scandal

Johnson faced criticism in July 2022 over the handling of a controversy surrounding Conservative MP Chris Pincher, who was accused of groping two men.

#### Mass resignations

A number of Conservative MPs resigned from the government in July 2022, including Chancellor Rishi Sunak and Health Secretary Sajid Javid.

#### Announcement of resignation

Johnson announced his resignation as Prime Minister and leader of the Conservative Party in July 2022, following the mass resignations.

Environmental policies
-------------------------

Johnson's government introduced a number of environmental policies, including the Environment Bill and the Climate Change Act.

Foreign policy
----------------

### Hong Kong and China

Johnson's government was critical of China's actions in Hong Kong, including the introduction of a national security law.

### Afghanistan

Johnson's government responded to the Taliban's takeover of Afghanistan in 2021, including the evacuation of British citizens and the provision of aid.

### UK–EU trade negotiation

Johnson's government negotiated a trade deal with the European Union, which was agreed in December 2020.

### Russia and Ukraine

Johnson's government was critical of Russia's actions in Ukraine, including the annexation of Crimea.

Post-premiership (2022–present)
------------------------------

Johnson has remained a Member of Parliament since his resignation as Prime Minister.

Political positions and ideology
---------------------------------

### Environment

Johnson has been a vocal supporter of environmental causes, including the introduction of a plastic bag tax.

### Immigration and the European Union

Johnson has been a long-standing critic of the European Union and has advocated for a more restrictive immigration policy.

### Unionism and devolution

Johnson has been a vocal supporter of the Union and has advocated for greater devolution of power to the regions.

Public image
-------------

Johnson has been known for his charismatic personality and his ability to connect with voters.

Personal life
-------------

### Religion

Johnson was baptized as a Catholic and confirmed as an Anglican.

### Relationships

Johnson has been married twice, first to Allegra Mostyn-Owen and then to Marina Wheeler.

### Family and ancestors

Johnson comes from a prominent family, including his father Stanley Johnson and his grandfather Wilfred Johnson.

Honours
--------

Johnson was appointed as a Privy Counsellor in 2016.

Works
------

Johnson has written a number of books, including "Seventy-Two Virgins" and "The Churchill Factor".

article:
Edson Arantes do Nascimento, known worldwide as Pelé, was a Brazilian professional footballer widely regarded as one of the greatest players of all time. He is a three-time World Cup winner and scored over 1,000 goals in his career, making him one of the most prolific goal-scorers in history.

#Early years

Pelé was born on October 23, 1940, in Três Corações, Minas Gerais, Brazil. He grew up in a poor family and was raised by his mother, Dona Celeste, and his father, João Ramos do Nascimento, a semi-professional footballer. Pelé's love for football began at an early age, and he would often play with his friends in the streets using makeshift balls made of socks and paper.

Pelé's early footballing talent was recognized by his father, who began training him at the age of 6. He joined his first youth team, Bauru Athletic Club, at the age of 11 and quickly established himself as a talented young player.

#Club career

##Santos

Pelé joined Santos FC in 1956 at the age of 15, and it was with the club that he would achieve most of his success.

###1956–1962: early years with Santos and declared a national treasure

Pelé made his professional debut for Santos in 1956 and quickly became a regular member of the team. In 1958, he helped Santos win the Campeonato Paulista, their first state championship in 20 years. Pelé's impressive performances caught the attention of the Brazilian national team, and he was called up to represent his country at the 1958 World Cup.

In 1961, Pelé was declared a national treasure by the Brazilian government, and his transfer rights were frozen, preventing him from being sold to a foreign club.

###1962–1965: Copa Libertadores success

In 1962, Pelé helped Santos win their first Copa Libertadores title, defeating Peñarol in the final. He scored 5 goals in the tournament, including 2 in the final. Santos went on to win the Copa Libertadores again in 1963, and Pelé was named the tournament's top scorer.

###1965–1974: O Milésimo and final years with Santos

In 1969, Pelé scored his 1,000th professional goal, known as O Milésimo, in a match against Vasco da Gama. He continued to play for Santos until 1974, helping the club win several more championships, including the 1973 Campeonato Paulista.

##Tours with Santos

Pelé and Santos went on several international tours during his time with the club, playing exhibition matches against top teams from around the world. These tours helped to establish Pelé as a global football superstar and increased his popularity worldwide.

##New York Cosmos

In 1975, Pelé joined the New York Cosmos of the North American Soccer League (NASL). He played for the Cosmos from 1975 to 1977, helping the team win the NASL championship in 1977. Pelé's signing with the Cosmos was a major coup for the NASL, and it helped to increase the popularity of football in the United States.

#International career

Pelé represented Brazil at four World Cups, winning three titles.

##1958 World Cup

Pelé made his World Cup debut in 1958, scoring 6 goals in the tournament, including 2 in the final against Sweden. Brazil won the tournament, and Pelé was named the World Cup's best young player.

##1959 South American Championship

Pelé played for Brazil at the 1959 South American Championship, scoring 8 goals in the tournament. Brazil finished second, behind Argentina.

##1962 World Cup

Pelé played for Brazil at the 1962 World Cup, but the team was eliminated in the quarterfinals, losing to Czechoslovakia.

##1966 World Cup

Pelé played for Brazil at the 1966 World Cup, but the team was eliminated in the group stage, losing to Portugal and Hungary.

##1970 World Cup

Pelé played for Brazil at the 1970 World Cup, helping the team win their third World Cup title. He scored 4 goals in the tournament, including 1 in the final against Italy.

#Style of play

Pelé was a prolific goal-scorer, known for his speed, skill, and power. He was a versatile player who could play anywhere on the field, but he was most effective as a center-forward. Pelé was also an excellent passer and playmaker, and he was known for his ability to read the game and create scoring opportunities for his teammates.

#Legacy

Pelé is widely regarded as one of the greatest football players of all time. He is a three-time World Cup winner and scored over 1,000 goals in his career. Pelé's legacy extends beyond his playing career, and he is widely regarded as a football icon and a global ambassador for the sport.

##Accolades

Pelé has received numerous accolades throughout his career, including:

* 3 World Cup titles
* 2 Copa Libertadores titles
* 6 Campeonato Paulista titles
* 1 NASL championship
* FIFA World Player of the Century
* Ballon d'Or winner (1970)
* FIFA Order of Merit

##"Pelé Pact" and Puma sponsorship

In 1970, Pelé signed a sponsorship deal with Puma, becoming one of the first athletes to sign a major endorsement contract. The deal was known as the "Pelé Pact," and it helped to establish Puma as a major player in the sports apparel market.

#Personal life

##Relationships and children

Pelé has been married three times and has seven children. His first marriage was to Rosemeri dos Reis Cholbi in 1966, and the couple had two daughters, Kelly and Jennifer. Pelé's second marriage was to Assíria Lemos Seixas in 1994, and the couple had twins, Joshua and Celeste. Pelé's third marriage was to Xuxa Meneghel in 2016.

##Politics

Pelé has been involved in various charitable and humanitarian efforts throughout his career, including working with UNICEF and the Brazilian government to promote education and healthcare for disadvantaged children.

##Religion

Pelé is a devout Catholic and has spoken publicly about the importance of his faith in his life.

##Health

Pelé has struggled with health issues throughout his life, including a knee injury that forced him to retire from football in 1977. He has also suffered from hip and back problems, and he has undergone several surgeries to address these issues.

#After football

After retiring from football, Pelé went on to become a successful businessman and entrepreneur. He has invested in various ventures, including real estate, hospitality, and sports marketing.

#Death and funeral

Pelé passed away on December 29, 2022, at the age of 82, after a long battle with colon cancer. His funeral was held in Santos, Brazil, and he was laid to rest in the Memorial Necropole Ecumenica cemetery.

#Career statistics

##Club

* Santos FC (1956-1974): 638 appearances, 643 goals
* New York Cosmos (1975-1977): 64 appearances, 37 goals

##International

* Brazil (1957-1971): 92 appearances, 77 goals

#Honours

* 3 World Cup titles

* FIFA Order of Merit

#Filmography

* O Mundo É um Moinho (2016)

article:
Avatar: The Way of Water
==========================

Avatar: The Way of Water is a 2022 American epic science fiction film directed by James Cameron and produced by 20th Century Studios. It is the sequel to the 2009 film Avatar, and the second installment in the Avatar film series. The film stars Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, Sigourney Weaver, Stephen Lang, and Cliff Curtis. The story takes place 13 years after the events of the first film and follows Jake Sully and Neytiri as they navigate a new threat to their people and the planet of Pandora.

Plot
-----

The film takes place in the underwater kingdom of the Metkayina clan, where Jake Sully (Sam Worthington) and Neytiri (Zoe Saldana) have built a life together. They have two sons, Neteyam (Jamie Flatters) and Lo'ak (Britain Dalton), and a adopted son named Spider (Jack Champion). However, their peaceful existence is disrupted by the arrival of a new threat: the human military, led by Colonel Miles Quaritch (Stephen Lang), who seeks to capture Jake and exploit the resources of Pandora.

As the conflict escalates, Jake and Neytiri must navigate the complex politics of the Metkayina clan and the human world, all while trying to protect their family and the planet from those who seek to harm it. Along the way, they discover new wonders and dangers in the depths of Pandora's oceans, and Lo'ak forms a bond with a captured tulkun, a massive sea creature.

Cast
-----

* Sam Worthington as Jake Sully
* Zoe Saldana as Neytiri
* Sigourney Weaver as Kiri
* Stephen Lang as Colonel Miles Quaritch
* Cliff Curtis as Tonowari
* Joel David Moore as Dr. Norm Spellman
* CCH Pounder as Mo'at
* Edie Falco as General Ardmore
* Jemaine Clement as Dr. Ian Garvin
* Jamie Flatters as Neteyam Sully
* Britain Dalton as Lo'ak Sully
* Jack Champion as Miles Socorro (Spider)

Themes and Analysis
-------------------

Avatar: The Way of Water explores several themes, including colonialism, identity, and the clash between technology and nature. The film critiques the exploitation of indigenous cultures and the natural world, highlighting the importance of respecting and preserving the delicate balance of the environment.

The film also explores the theme of identity, particularly through the character of Lo'ak, who struggles to find his place within the Metkayina clan. The film's use of performance capture and visual effects allows for a nuanced and realistic portrayal of the characters' emotions and interactions.

Production
------------

### Development

The development of Avatar: The Way of Water began in 2010, shortly after the release of the first film. James Cameron had always envisioned a trilogy, and began working on the script and story for the sequel. The film was initially scheduled for release in 2014, but was delayed several times due to the complexity of the production and the development of new technology.

### Writing

James Cameron wrote the screenplay for Avatar: The Way of Water, with contributions from Josh Friedman, Rick Jaffa, Amanda Silver, and Shane Salerno. The script was influenced by Cameron's own experiences as a deep-sea explorer and his fascination with the ocean and its creatures.

### Casting

The casting process for Avatar: The Way of Water began in 2017, with the announcement of several new cast members, including Cliff Curtis and Joel David Moore. The film's cast includes several returning actors from the first film, including Sam Worthington, Zoe Saldana, and Stephen Lang.

### Filming

#### Performance Capture

The film's performance capture was conducted at Weta Digital in Wellington, New Zealand. The cast performed in a large, custom-built volume, using advanced motion capture technology to record their movements and expressions. The performance capture process took over a year to complete, with the cast performing in front of a virtual camera system that allowed Cameron to direct and monitor the action in real-time.

#### Live-Action

The film's live-action sequences were shot on location in New Zealand and Hawaii. The production team built several large sets, including a replica of the human military base and a section of the Metkayina clan's underwater city.

### Visual Effects

The film's visual effects were created by Weta Digital, with a team of over 2,000 artists and technicians working on the project. The film's visual effects include complex simulations of water and sea creatures, as well as the creation of the film's virtual environments and characters. The visual effects process took over three years to complete, with the team working closely with Cameron to ensure that the film's visuals met his high standards.

### Runtime

The film's runtime is 192 minutes (3 hours and 12 minutes), making it one of the longest films of the year.

Music
------

The film's score was composed by Simon Franglen, with contributions from James Horner and James Cameron. The score features a combination of traditional orchestral instruments and choral pieces, as well as the use of native instrumentation and vocal performances.

Marketing
----------

The film's marketing campaign began in 2020, with the release of several teasers and trailers. The campaign included a range of promotional materials, including posters, print ads, and social media promotions.

Release
--------

### Home Media

The film was released on digital platforms in March 2023, with a physical release on DVD and Blu-ray in May 2023.

Reception
----------

### Box Office

#### United States and Canada

The film opened in the United States and Canada on December 16, 2022, grossing $134.1 million in its opening weekend. The film went on to gross over $650 million in the domestic market.

#### China

The film opened in China on December 16, 2022, grossing $57.4 million in its opening weekend. The film went on to gross over $200 million in the Chinese market.

2023 NHL Entry Draft

The 2023 NHL Entry Draft was the 61st NHL Entry Draft, held from June 28 to 29, 2023, at the Bridgestone Arena in Nashville, Tennessee. The draft was the first to be held in Nashville since 2003. The draft consisted of seven rounds, with the first round taking place on June 28 and the remaining rounds on June 29. A total of 225 players were selected from around the world, including 142 forwards, 64 defensemen, and 19 goaltenders.

# Eligibility

The eligibility rules for the 2023 NHL Entry Draft were as follows:

* All players born between January 1, 2003, and September 15, 2005, were eligible for selection.
* Players not chosen in the 2021 or 2022 NHL Entry Drafts were also eligible.
* Players who were previously drafted but did not sign an entry-level contract with their respective teams were also eligible.

# Draft Lottery

The 2023 NHL Draft Lottery was held on May 8, 2023, to determine the order of selection for the first 16 teams in the draft. * The Chicago Blackhawks won the first overall pick, moving up from the fourth spot.
* The Anaheim Ducks moved up to the second spot, while the Columbus Blue Jackets dropped to the third spot.
* The remaining teams maintained their original positions.

article:
WrestleMania 38 was the 38th annual WrestleMania professional wrestling event produced by WWE. It took place on April 2 and 3, 2022, at the AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas.

# Production

## Background
WrestleMania 38 was first announced on April 3, 2021, during WrestleMania 37, with AT&T Stadium in Arlington, Texas, being announced as the host venue. This marked the third time that the state of Texas hosted WrestleMania, after WrestleMania 25 in 2009 and WrestleMania 32 in 2016. Tickets for the event went on sale on November 12, 2021.

## Broadcast outlets
WrestleMania 38 was available to stream on Peacock in the United States and the WWE Network internationally. The event was also available to purchase through various pay-per-view providers.

## Celebrity involvement
Several celebrities were involved in WrestleMania 38. Grits and Biscuits, a combination of rapper Snoop Dogg and wrestler Sasha Banks, performed during the event. Additionally, Logan Paul, a popular YouTuber, made his WWE in-ring debut at the event.

## Other WrestleMania Week events
As part of the WrestleMania Week festivities, WWE hosted several other events. These included the 2022 WWE Hall of Fame ceremony, which took place on April 1, 2022, at the American Airlines Center in Dallas, Texas. The event honored several inductees, including The Undertaker, Kane, and the Steiner Brothers. WWE also hosted a WrestleMania Superstore at the Kay Bailey Hutchison Convention Center in Dallas, Texas, which featured various WWE merchandise and interactive experiences.

## Storylines
The storylines for WrestleMania 38 were built up through several weeks of television programming and pay-per-view events. The event featured several high-profile matches, including championship bouts and grudge matches.

### Main event matches
The main event matches for WrestleMania 38 were headlined by Roman Reigns defending the WWE Universal Championship against Brock Lesnar, and Stone Cold Steve Austin facing off against Kevin Owens in a No Holds Barred match.

### Undercard matches
The undercard for WrestleMania 38 featured several notable matches, including Ronda Rousey facing off against Charlotte Flair for the SmackDown Women's Championship, and The Usos defending the SmackDown Tag Team Championship against Shinsuke Nakamura and Rick Boogs.

# Event

## Night 1
The first night of WrestleMania 38 took place on April 2, 2022, and featured several high-profile matches.

### Preliminary matches
The event kicked off with a match between Cody Rhodes and Seth Rollins, which Cody won. This was followed by a match between Drew McIntyre and Happy Corbin, which Drew won. The New Day then faced off against Sheamus and Ridge Holland, with The New Day emerging victorious.

### Main event
The main event of Night 1 saw Stone Cold Steve Austin face off against Kevin Owens in a No Holds Barred match. The match was highly physical, with both men using various objects to attack each other. In the end, Stone Cold emerged victorious.

## Night 2
The second night of WrestleMania 38 took place on April 3, 2022, and featured several high-profile matches.

### Preliminary matches
The event kicked off with a match between Bianca Belair and Becky Lynch for the Raw Women's Championship, which Bianca won. This was followed by a match between Sami Zayn and Johnny Knoxville, which Johnny won. Ronda Rousey then faced off against Charlotte Flair for the SmackDown Women's Championship, but lost.

### Main event
The main event of Night 2 saw Roman Reigns defend the WWE Universal Championship against Brock Lesnar in a Winner Takes All match, with the WWE Championship also on the line. The match was highly physical, with both men using various moves to try and gain the upper hand. In the end, Roman emerged victorious.

# Reception
WrestleMania 38 received generally positive reviews from critics and fans. Many praised the event's matches, particularly the main events, and the overall production quality.

# Aftermath

## Raw
On the April 4, 2022, episode of Raw, Roman Reigns celebrated his victory over Brock Lesnar. Meanwhile, Cody Rhodes set his sights on the WWE Championship, and Bianca Belair celebrated her victory over Becky Lynch.

## SmackDown
On the April 8, 2022, episode of SmackDown, Ronda Rousey addressed her loss to Charlotte Flair, and The Usos celebrated their victory over Shinsuke Nakamura and Rick Boogs.

# Results

* Cody Rhodes defeated Seth Rollins
* Drew McIntyre defeated Happy Corbin
* The New Day (Kofi Kingston and Xavier Woods) defeated Sheamus and Ridge Holland
* Stone Cold Steve Austin defeated Kevin Owens in a No Holds Barred match
* Bianca Belair defeated Becky Lynch for the Raw Women's Championship
* Johnny Knoxville defeated Sami Zayn
* Charlotte Flair defeated Ronda Rousey for the SmackDown Women's Championship
* The Usos (Jimmy Uso and Jey Uso) defeated Shinsuke Nakamura and Rick Boogs for the SmackDown Tag Team Championship
* Roman Reigns defeated Brock Lesnar in a Winner Takes All match for the WWE Universal Championship and WWE Championship

# Notes

* WrestleMania 38 was the first WrestleMania to take place over two nights since WrestleMania 36 in 2020.

article:
Mutiny Acts

The Mutiny Acts were a series of laws passed by the English, British, and UK parliaments to regulate and maintain discipline within the military, particularly in the British Army. These acts were instrumental in establishing the authority of the government over the armed forces and preventing insubordination and mutinies. This article provides an overview of the background, passage, and renewal of the Mutiny Acts, as well as their role in shaping the British military.

#Background

Prior to the 17th century, the English military was governed by a complex system of laws and regulations, which often led to confusion and conflicts. The medieval feudal system, where lords and nobles maintained their own private armies, had largely given way to a centralized military force, but the rules governing this force were not clearly defined. As the British Empire expanded, the need for a more effective and efficient military organization became increasingly important.

In 1641, the English Parliament passed the Triennial Act, which required the army to be disbanded and reassembled every three years. However, this act did not provide sufficient authority to maintain discipline within the military. It was not until the Restoration of the monarchy in 1660 that the first Mutiny Act was passed, marking the beginning of a new era in military governance.

#Passage of the first Mutiny Act

The first Mutiny Act was passed in 1689, during the reign of William III. This act was designed to maintain discipline within the British Army and to prevent mutinies. The act established a clear hierarchy of authority, with the monarch at the top and a system of courts-martial to try soldiers accused of offenses. The act also defined the powers of military officers, including their authority to punish soldiers for disobedience and neglect of duty.

The passage of the first Mutiny Act marked an important milestone in the development of the British military. For the first time, the government had established a clear and comprehensive system of governance for the armed forces. The act also provided a framework for the expansion of the British Empire, as a disciplined and well-organized military was essential for the maintenance of colonial rule.

#Renewal of the Mutiny Acts

The Mutiny Acts were initially passed as temporary measures, but they were repeatedly renewed and updated over the years. The acts were typically renewed for a period of one year, although some were extended for longer periods. The renewal of the Mutiny Acts became an annual ritual, with some minor amendments and changes being made each year.

The renewal of the Mutiny Acts served several purposes. Firstly, it allowed the government to maintain control over the military and to ensure that discipline was maintained. Secondly, it provided an opportunity for the government to update and refine the laws governing the military. Finally, the renewal of the Mutiny Acts helped to reinforce the authority of the government over the armed forces.

#The Quartering Acts

The Quartering Acts were a series of laws passed in the 18th century to provide for the quartering of soldiers in the American colonies. The acts were designed to provide a more efficient and cost-effective means of maintaining a military presence in the colonies. However, they were deeply unpopular among the colonists, who saw them as an attempt to impose British rule on the colonies.

The Quartering Acts were closely linked to the Mutiny Acts, as they provided for the quartering of soldiers who were subject to the Mutiny Acts. The Quartering Acts also reinforced the authority of the government over the military, as they provided a means of maintaining discipline and control over soldiers stationed in the colonies.

article:
Tornado Outbreak of November 4–5, 2022

The Tornado Outbreak of November 4–5, 2022, was a significant severe weather event that affected parts of the United States, particularly the Southern Plains. During the two-day period, a series of tornadoes touched down across Texas and Oklahoma, causing widespread damage and disruption. This article provides an overview of the meteorological conditions that led to the outbreak, the confirmed tornadoes, and the impacts of the event.

# Meteorological Synopsis

A strong low-pressure system developed over the Rocky Mountains on November 3, 2022, and began to move eastward, bringing with it a cold front and a dry line. As the system interacted with the warm, moist air from the Gulf of Mexico, it created a highly unstable atmosphere, conducive to thunderstorm development. The Storm Prediction Center (SPC) issued a Moderate Risk (4/5) for severe weather on November 4, indicating a significant threat of tornadoes, large hail, and damaging winds.

As the cold front and dry line pushed eastward, they interacted with the warm, moist air, creating a focal point for thunderstorm development. The SPC upgraded the risk to High Risk (5/5) for parts of Texas and Oklahoma, indicating a high likelihood of long-lived tornadoes and significant damage. The outbreak occurred during the late afternoon and evening hours of November 4 and the early morning hours of November 5.

# Confirmed Tornadoes

A total of 11 tornadoes were confirmed during the outbreak, with the majority occurring on November 4.

## November 4 Event

The first tornado of the outbreak touched down at 4:45 PM CST in Fannin County, Texas. The tornado, classified as EF1, caused minor damage and injured one person. Over the next few hours, multiple tornadoes touched down across Texas and Oklahoma, including a long-lived EF3 tornado that affected several counties in Texas.

## November 5 Event

The tornado activity continued into the early morning hours of November 5, with several tornadoes touching down in Oklahoma. The most significant tornado of the day was an EF2 that affected parts of McCurtain County, Oklahoma.

## Brookston–Caviness–Midcity–Arthur City, Texas/Sawyer, Oklahoma

This long-lived tornado, classified as EF3, touched down at 6:20 PM CST in Fannin County, Texas, and remained on the ground for approximately 45 miles. The tornado caused significant damage and injured several people.

## Bogota–Clarksville–Acworth, Texas/Idabel–Broken Bow–Eagletown, Oklahoma

This tornado, classified as EF2, touched down at 7:15 PM CST in Red River County, Texas, and remained on the ground for approximately 30 miles. The tornado caused significant damage and injured several people.

## Cason–Naples, Texas

This tornado, classified as EF1, touched down at 8:30 PM CST in Morris County, Texas, and remained on the ground for approximately 10 miles. The tornado caused minor damage and injured one person.

## Simms–New Boston, Texas

This tornado, classified as EF1, touched down at 9:15 PM CST in Bowie County, Texas, and remained on the ground for approximately 15 miles. The tornado caused minor damage and injured one person.

# Non-Tornadic Effects

In addition to the tornadoes, the outbreak also produced significant non-tornadic effects, including large hail and damaging winds. Several reports of hail up to 2 inches in diameter were received, and winds gusts of up to 70 mph were recorded.

# Impact

The tornado outbreak had a significant impact on the affected areas, causing widespread damage and disruption. Several homes and businesses were destroyed, and numerous trees and power lines were downed. The outbreak also caused several injuries and one fatality.

article:
Yeti Airlines Flight 691 was a scheduled domestic passenger flight that crashed on January 15, 2023, while attempting to land at Pokhara International Airport in Pokhara, Nepal. The accident resulted in the deaths of all 72 people on board, making it one of the deadliest aviation accidents in Nepalese history.

# Accident

The flight, operated by an ATR 72-500 aircraft, was flying from Tribhuvan International Airport in Kathmandu to Pokhara International Airport. The flight departed Kathmandu at 10:33 local time and was scheduled to arrive at Pokhara at 10:55. However, at 11:10, the aircraft crashed into the Seti River gorge, approximately 1.5 kilometers (0.9 miles) from the airport.

Eyewitnesses reported that the aircraft was flying low and appeared to be experiencing technical difficulties before crashing. The impact was severe, and the aircraft was completely destroyed. Rescue efforts were hindered by the remote location and difficult terrain.

# Aircraft

The aircraft involved in the accident was an ATR 72-500, registration 9N-ANC, manufactured in 2007. The aircraft had accumulated over 36,000 flight hours and had undergone routine maintenance checks before the accident. The ATR 72-500 is a twin-engine turboprop aircraft commonly used for short-haul flights.

The aircraft was equipped with a cockpit voice recorder (CVR) and a flight data recorder (FDR), which were recovered from the crash site. The data from these recorders was crucial in the investigation into the cause of the accident.

# Passengers and crew

There were 72 people on board the flight, including four crew members. The passengers included Nepalese nationals, as well as citizens of several foreign countries, including India, South Korea, and Australia. The crew consisted of two pilots, a cabin crew member, and a flight engineer.

The pilots were experienced, with the captain having over 5,000 hours of flight experience and the first officer having over 1,500 hours. The cabin crew member was also experienced, having worked for the airline for several years.

# Aftermath

The accident was met with widespread shock and grief in Nepal. The government declared a national day of mourning, and flags were flown at half-mast across the country. The airline also issued a statement expressing its condolences to the families of the victims.

Rescue efforts were coordinated by the Nepalese government, with assistance from international agencies. The crash site was difficult to access, and rescue teams had to navigate challenging terrain to reach the site.

# Investigation

The investigation into the accident was led by the Nepal Civil Aviation Authority (CAAN), with assistance from international agencies, including the French Bureau of Enquiry and Analysis for Civil Aviation Safety (BEA) and the Australian Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB).

## Preliminary report

The preliminary report into the accident was released on January 25, 2023. The report noted that the aircraft had been experiencing technical difficulties before the crash, including issues with the autopilot system. The report also noted that the pilots had been attempting to manually control the aircraft before the crash.

The report did not identify a definitive cause of the accident but highlighted several factors that may have contributed to the crash. These included the technical difficulties experienced by the aircraft, as well as the challenging weather conditions in the area.

## Final report

The final report into the accident was released on June 15, 2023. The report concluded that the probable cause of the accident was a combination of technical difficulties and human error. The report noted that the pilots had been attempting to manually control the aircraft after the autopilot system failed but had lost control of the aircraft due to spatial disorientation.

The report also noted that the challenging weather conditions in the area, including low visibility and strong winds, had contributed to the accident. The report made several recommendations for improving aviation safety in Nepal, including the implementation of more robust maintenance procedures and the provision of additional training for pilots.

This article is based on publicly available information and may not reflect the most up-to-date information on the accident.

article:
James Davis ( Printer )

James Davis was a colonial American printer, publisher, and politician who played a significant role in the development of North Carolina's print industry during the mid-18th century. Born in 1721, Davis would go on to establish himself as one of the most prominent printers in the colony, producing various publications, including the North Carolina Gazette and The North Carolina Magazine.

# Early and family life

James Davis was born in 1721 in Pennsylvania to a family of modest means. Little is known about his early life, but it is believed that he received some formal education, which would later serve him well in his printing career. Davis's family relocated to North Carolina in the 1730s, settling in the growing port city of New Bern. Here, Davis would begin his apprenticeship as a printer under the guidance of a local printer.

In 1745, Davis married Elizabeth Blount, a member of a prominent local family. The couple would go on to have several children together, and their family would play an important role in Davis's personal and professional life.

# Printing career

Davis's printing career spanned several decades and saw him establish himself as one of the leading printers in North Carolina.

## North Carolina Gazette

In 1751, Davis founded the North Carolina Gazette, the colony's first newspaper. Published weekly, the Gazette provided news from across the colony, as well as international news from Europe and other parts of the American colonies. The paper quickly gained popularity, and Davis became known for his editorial commentary on local and national issues.

## The North Carolina Magazine

In 1764, Davis launched The North Carolina Magazine, a monthly publication that featured articles on various subjects, including literature, science, and politics. The magazine was aimed at a more refined audience and provided a platform for local writers and thinkers to share their ideas.

## Counterfeiting allegations

In 1763, Davis was accused of counterfeiting, a serious offense that could have resulted in severe punishment. The allegations centered on Davis's production of paper money for the colony, which some claimed was not authorized by the colonial government. While Davis maintained his innocence, the controversy surrounding the allegations would continue to plague him for several years.

# Political career

In addition to his printing career, Davis was also involved in local politics. In 1764, he was elected to the North Carolina General Assembly, where he represented the interests of his constituents. Davis's time in the assembly was marked by controversy, as he clashed with other politicians over issues such as taxation and governance.

# Final days and legacy

James Davis died in 1785, at the age of 64. His legacy as a printer and publisher is still celebrated today, as he played a significant role in the development of North Carolina's print industry. Despite the controversies that surrounded him, Davis remains an important figure in American colonial history.

article:
The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power

The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power is a fantasy drama television series developed by J.D. Payne and Patrick McKay for Amazon Prime Video. Based on the works of J.R.R. Tolkien, the show is set in Middle-earth, 3,000 years before the events of The Lord of the Rings novel. The series explores the untold stories of the Second Age, a time of great turmoil and transformation in the realm of Middle-earth.

# Premise

The series is set in the Second Age of Middle-earth, a time when the Dark Lord Sauron forged the Rings of Power, powerful artifacts that grant immense power and control to their bearers. The show follows a diverse ensemble cast of characters, including Elves, Dwarves, Humans, and others, as they navigate the treacherous landscape of Middle-earth and confront the growing darkness. From the Elves' misty realm of Lindon to the Dwarven kingdom of Khazad-dûm, the series explores the complexities of Middle-earth's cultures, histories, and mythologies.

# Episodes

## Season 1 (2022)

The first season of The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power consists of eight episodes, which premiered on September 2, 2022. The season introduces the main characters and storylines, including the forging of the Rings of Power, the rise of Sauron, and the emergence of the Halflings. The episodes are:

1. "A Shadow of the Past"
2. "Adrift"
3. "Adar"
4. "The Great Wave"
5. "Partings"
6. "Udûn"
7. "The Eye"
8. "Alloyed"

## Season 2 (2024)

The second season of The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power is currently in production and is expected to premiere in 2024. The season will continue to explore the storylines and characters introduced in the first season, delving deeper into the complexities of Middle-earth's histories and cultures.

# Cast and characters

The Lord of the Rings: The Rings of Power features a diverse and international cast, including:
