article:
Top Gun: Maverick

Top Gun: Maverick is a 2022 American action drama film directed by Joseph Kosinski and written by Ehren Kruger, Eric Warren Singer, and Christopher McQuarrie. The film is a sequel to the 1986 film Top Gun and stars Tom Cruise, Miles Teller, Jennifer Connelly, Jon Hamm, and Val Kilmer. The movie follows Maverick, a test pilot and flight instructor, as he returns to the Top Gun program to train a new generation of pilots.

# Plot

The film takes place 34 years after the events of the first film and follows Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell (Tom Cruise), a test pilot and flight instructor who has been assigned to train a new generation of pilots at the Top Gun program. Maverick is tasked with preparing an elite team of pilots for a mission to destroy an underground uranium facility in an unnamed enemy country. The team is led by Lieutenant Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw (Miles Teller), the son of Maverick's late friend and Radar Intercept Officer, Nick "Goose" Bradshaw.

As Maverick trains the team, he faces opposition from the program's new commander, Rear Admiral Chester "Hammer" Cain (Ed Harris), who is skeptical of Maverick's unorthodox training methods. Maverick also reconnects with his former love interest, Penny Benjamin (Jennifer Connelly), who is now a single mother.

The team faces a series of challenges as they prepare for the mission, including navigating the complexities of modern aerial warfare and confronting their own personal demons. Maverick's methods are put to the test as the team faces a series of intense training exercises, and he must confront his own mortality and the legacy of his past.

# Cast

The film features an ensemble cast, including:

* Tom Cruise as Captain Pete "Maverick" Mitchell
* Miles Teller as Lieutenant Bradley "Rooster" Bradshaw
* Jennifer Connelly as Penny Benjamin
* Jon Hamm as Vice Admiral Cyclone
* Val Kilmer as Admiral Tom "Iceman" Kazansky
* Ed Harris as Rear Admiral Chester "Hammer" Cain
* Glen Powell as Lieutenant Junior Grade Bradley "Hangman" Seresin
* Lewis Pullman as Lieutenant Robert "Bob" Floyd
* Charles Parnell as Chief Warrant Officer 4 Solomon "Warlock" Bates
* Bashir Salahuddin as Chief Warrant Officer 4 Bertrand "Mustang" Hinds
* Monica Barbaro as Lieutenant Natasha "Phoenix" Trace
* Jay Ellis as Lieutenant Reuben "Payback" Fitch

# Production

## Development

The development of Top Gun: Maverick began in 2010, when Paramount Pictures announced plans to produce a sequel to the original film. Tom Cruise was attached to reprise his role as Maverick, and the studio began working on a script. However, the project stalled in 2012, and it wasn't until 2017 that the studio announced that the film was back in development.

## Writing

The screenplay for Top Gun: Maverick was written by Ehren Kruger, Eric Warren Singer, and Christopher McQuarrie. The script was developed from a story by Peter Craig and Justin Marks, and it incorporates elements from the original film. The writers consulted with the U.S. Navy and drew inspiration from real-life military operations.

## Casting

Casting for the film began in 2017, with Tom Cruise reprising his role as Maverick. Miles Teller was cast as Rooster, and Jennifer Connelly joined the cast as Penny Benjamin. The film also features a number of newcomers, including Glen Powell, Lewis Pullman, and Monica Barbaro.

## Filming

Principal photography for Top Gun: Maverick began in May 2018 and wrapped in November 2018. The film was shot on location in San Diego, California, and at the Naval Air Station Fallon in Nevada. The film's aerial sequences were shot using a combination of real aircraft and CGI.

## Aircraft

The film features a range of military aircraft, including the F/A-18 Hornet, the F-14 Tomcat, and the Darkstar.

### Darkstar

The Darkstar is a fictional, experimental aircraft that plays a key role in the film's plot. The aircraft is a nod to the real-life Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird, and it features a similar design.

### F-14

The F-14 Tomcat is a retired U.S. Navy fighter aircraft that is featured prominently in the film. The aircraft is a nod to the original film, in which Maverick flies an F-14.

## Post-production

Post-production for Top Gun: Maverick began in 2019 and wrapped in 2022. The film's visual effects were created by a team of artists and technicians, who worked to create realistic aerial sequences and environments.

# Music

The film's score was composed by Harold Faltermeyer, who also composed the score for the original film. The score features a range of themes, including the iconic "Danger Zone" theme.

# Marketing

The marketing campaign for Top Gun: Maverick began in 2019, with the release of a teaser trailer. The campaign included a range of promotional materials, including posters, trailers, and social media content.

# Release

## Theatrical

Top Gun: Maverick was released in theaters on May 27, 2022. The film was released in IMAX and 3D formats, and it received a wide release in the United States and around the world.

## Home media

The film was released on digital platforms on August 23, 2022, and on Blu-ray and DVD on November 1, 2022.

# Reception

## Box office

Top Gun: Maverick was a commercial success, grossing over $1.4 billion at the box office worldwide. The film broke a number of box office records, including the largest opening weekend for a Tom Cruise film.

## Critical response

The film received positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's action sequences, performances, and nostalgic value.

### Industry response

The film received a number of awards and nominations, including a nomination for Best Original Song at the 95th Academy Awards.

## Role of the U.S. military

The film was produced in cooperation with the U.S. Navy, and it features a number of real-life military personnel and locations. The film's portrayal of the U.S. military has been praised for its accuracy and authenticity.

Chris Rock–Will Smith Slapping Incident

The Chris Rock–Will Smith slapping incident was a highly publicized altercation that occurred during the 94th Academy Awards ceremony, held on March 27, 2022, at the Dolby Theatre in Hollywood, Los Angeles. The incident involved American actor Will Smith slapping American comedian Chris Rock on stage, after Rock made a joke about Smith's wife, Jada Pinkett Smith.

#Background

The 94th Academy Awards ceremony was held to honor the best in film for 2021. Chris Rock, a renowned comedian, was invited to present the award for Best Documentary Feature. Will Smith, a prominent actor, was nominated for Best Actor for his role in the film "King Richard." Jada Pinkett Smith, Will's wife, has been open about her struggles with alopecia areata, a condition that causes hair loss.

#Incident

During the ceremony, Chris Rock took the stage to present the award for Best Documentary Feature. Before announcing the winner, Rock made a joke about Jada Pinkett Smith's hair, saying, "Jada, I love ya. G.I. Jane 2, can't wait to see it." The joke was a reference to the 1997 film "G.I. Jane," in which the main character, played by Demi Moore, has a shaved head.

##Photograph

A photograph of the incident, showing Will Smith slapping Chris Rock, was widely shared on social media. The image, captured by photographer Chris Pizzello, shows Smith's hand making contact with Rock's face, with a shocked expression on Rock's face.

##Uncensored viewership

The incident was broadcast live on television, and many viewers saw the altercation unfold in real-time. However, the audio of the slap was censored in some countries, including the United States, where the ceremony was broadcast on ABC.

In the days following the incident, additional videos emerged showing the aftermath of the slap. One video, captured by a bystander, shows Will Smith shouting at Chris Rock to "keep my wife's name out of your f***ing mouth." Another video, captured by a photographer, shows Smith and Rock talking backstage after the incident, with Smith appearing to apologize to Rock.

#Aftermath

The incident sparked a heated debate on social media, with many people weighing in on whether Will Smith's actions were justified. The incident also led to a formal review by the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences.

##Initial response

In the immediate aftermath of the incident, the Academy released a statement condemning the violence. Chris Rock, meanwhile, chose not to press charges against Smith.

##Public apologies

In the days following the incident, both Will Smith and Chris Rock issued public apologies. Smith apologized to Rock and the Academy, saying, "My behavior at last night's Academy Awards was unacceptable and inexcusable." Rock, meanwhile, joked about the incident during a stand-up comedy routine, saying, "I'm still kind of processing what happened."

##Formal Academy review

The Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences launched a formal review of the incident, which included interviews with witnesses and a review of the evidence. The review ultimately led to Will Smith's resignation from the Academy and a 10-year ban from attending the Oscars.

##Resignation and ban

On April 1, 2022, Will Smith announced his resignation from the Academy of Motion Picture Arts and Sciences. The Academy, meanwhile, issued a statement saying that Smith would be banned from attending the Oscars for 10 years.

##Smith film delayed

In the aftermath of the incident, the release of Will Smith's film "Emancipation" was delayed. The film, which was originally set to be released in 2022, was pushed back to 2023.

##Later responses

In the months following the incident, both Will Smith and Chris Rock continued to address the altercation in public. Smith, meanwhile, released a video apologizing to Rock and the Academy, saying, "I am deeply remorseful for my actions."

#Reactions

The incident sparked a wide range of reactions on social media, with many people weighing in on whether Will Smith's actions were justified.

##Individuals

Many individuals, including celebrities and politicians, weighed in on the incident on social media. Some, including Tiffany Haddish and Nicki Minaj, defended Will Smith's actions, while others, including Kathy Griffin and Mia Farrow, condemned the violence.

##Comedians

Many comedians, including Dave Chappelle and Ricky Gervais, addressed the incident in their stand-up routines. Chappelle, meanwhile, joked about the incident, saying, "I'm not saying Will Smith is a bad guy, but he slapped Chris Rock harder than he hit his kids."

##Politicians

Some politicians, including Representative Ayanna Pressley, weighed in on the incident on social media. Pressley, who has spoken publicly about her own struggles with alopecia, defended Jada Pinkett Smith and condemned the violence.

##Accusations of staging

Some people accused Will Smith and Chris Rock of staging the incident as a publicity stunt. However, both men denied the allegations, with Smith saying, "I would never do that."

##Alopecia awareness

The incident raised awareness about alopecia areata, a condition that causes hair loss. Many people took to social media to share their own experiences with the condition and to defend Jada Pinkett Smith.

##Views on criminality

The incident sparked a debate about whether Will Smith's actions were criminal. Some people argued that Smith's slap was a form of assault, while others argued that it was a justified response to Chris Rock's joke.

##Memes

The incident sparked a wide range of memes on social media, with many people joking about the altercation. One meme, which showed Will Smith slapping Chris Rock, was captioned, "When you finally get tired of your wife's jokes."

#Analysis

The incident has been analyzed by many experts, who have weighed in on the potential causes and consequences of the altercation.

##Potential causes

Some experts have suggested that the incident was caused by a combination of factors, including Will Smith's protectiveness of his wife and Chris Rock's joke about Jada Pinkett Smith's hair. Others have suggested that the incident was a result of the pressure and stress of the awards ceremony.

##Comparisons with historic Academy incidents

article:
Georgia Election Racketeering Prosecution

The Georgia election racketeering prosecution is a high-profile criminal case in the United States involving allegations of conspiracy to overturn the 2020 presidential election results in the state of Georgia. The case, led by Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis, centers on the actions of several individuals, including former President Donald Trump and his allies, who allegedly engaged in a racketeering scheme to pressure state officials, create false electoral vote documents, and breach election equipment.

# Background

## Prior to and during election day

In the months leading up to the 2020 presidential election, President Trump and his campaign repeatedly made false claims about the integrity of the electoral process in Georgia. Following the election, which saw Democratic candidate Joe Biden win the state by a narrow margin, Trump and his allies intensified their efforts to contest the results. These efforts included filing lawsuits, making public statements, and engaging in behind-the-scenes pressure campaigns aimed at state officials.

## Efforts to pressure Georgia state officials

In December 2020, President Trump and his allies, including then-White House Chief of Staff Mark Meadows and attorney Rudy Giuliani, began a series of calls and meetings with high-ranking Georgia state officials. The purpose of these interactions was to pressure the officials into taking actions that would alter the outcome of the election, such as convening a special session of the state legislature or appointing a new slate of electors. The officials targeted by these efforts included Governor Brian Kemp, Secretary of State Brad Raffensperger, and Lieutenant Governor Geoff Duncan.

## Creation of false electoral vote documents

As part of their efforts to subvert the election results, Trump and his allies allegedly created false electoral vote documents, which were then submitted to the National Archives and the Georgia Secretary of State's office. These documents claimed to represent the official electoral votes of the state of Georgia, but were in fact forgeries created by Trump supporters.

## Coffee County election equipment breach

In January 2021, a group of Trump supporters, including Catherine Engelbrecht and Mark Davis of the organization True the Vote, gained unauthorized access to election equipment in Coffee County, Georgia. The breach, which was allegedly facilitated by local election officials, allowed the group to copy sensitive data and compromise the security of the equipment.

## Harassment of Fulton County election workers

Throughout 2020 and 2021, Fulton County election workers, including Ruby Freeman and her daughter Shaye Moss, were subjected to a campaign of harassment and intimidation by Trump supporters. The harassment, which included death threats, vandalism, and public ridicule, was allegedly inspired by false claims made by Trump and his allies about the workers' role in the election.

# Indictment

## Charges

In August 2023, Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis indicted 18 individuals, including former President Trump, on charges related to the alleged racketeering scheme. The charges include:

* Racketeering
* Solicitation of violation of oath by public officer
* Tampering with witnesses
* Influencing witnesses
* Unlawful possession of ballots or voting equipment
* False statements and writings

## Defendants

The defendants in the case include:

* Donald Trump
* Mark Meadows
* Rudy Giuliani
* Catherine Engelbrecht
* Mark Davis
* Sidney Powell
* Lin Wood
* John Eastman
* Boris Epshteyn
* Kenneth Chesebro
* Jenna Ellis
* Alex Kaufman
* Harrison Floyd
* Sean McFadden
* Michael Flynn
* Patrick Byrne
* Jeffrey Clark
* Kenneth Almstead

# Initial proceedings

## Surrender and booking

Following the indictment, several of the defendants surrendered to authorities and were booked into the Fulton County Jail. The defendants were later released on bond.

## Arraignments

The defendants were arraigned in September 2023, at which time they entered pleas of not guilty to the charges.

# Pretrial motions

## Attempts to dismiss charges

Several defendants filed motions to dismiss the charges, arguing that the indictment was flawed or that the prosecution had engaged in misconduct. These motions were denied by the trial court.

## Attempts to remove to federal court

Some defendants attempted to have the case removed to federal court, arguing that the charges involved federal crimes or that the prosecution was motivated by partisan politics. These attempts were unsuccessful.

## Speedy trial and severance requests

Several defendants requested a speedy trial, arguing that the prosecution had delayed the case unnecessarily. Other defendants requested severance, arguing that they should be tried separately from the other defendants. These requests were denied by the trial court.

## Dismissal of solicitation and false documents charges

In October 2023, the trial court dismissed two of the charges against the defendants, including the solicitation of violation of oath by public officer charge and the false statements and writings charge.

# Proceedings on prosecutorial impropriety

## Background

In September 2023, several defendants filed motions alleging prosecutorial impropriety, including claims that District Attorney Willis had engaged in partisan politics or that the prosecution had withheld exculpatory evidence.

## Hearing

The trial court held a hearing on the motions, at which time the defendants presented evidence and testimony.

## Ruling and aftermath

The trial court ultimately denied the motions, finding that the prosecution had not engaged in misconduct. The defendants appealed the ruling, which is currently pending.

## Appeal to dismiss Fani Willis from the case

The defendants also appealed the trial court's denial of their motion to dismiss Fani Willis from the case, arguing that she had a conflict of interest or that she had engaged in misconduct. The appeal is currently pending.

# Guilty pleas

## Proffer video leak

In October 2023, a video of a proffer session between the prosecution and defendant Kenneth Chesebro was leaked to the media. The video showed Chesebro discussing his role in the alleged scheme and his interactions with other defendants.

# Trials

The trial is currently scheduled to begin in January 2024 and is expected to last several months.

## Procedures and potential witnesses

The trial will be a jury trial, with the prosecution presenting evidence and testimony from a range of witnesses, including state officials, election workers, and Trump allies. The defense will also present evidence and testimony, including from expert witnesses and character witnesses.

article:
2023 UEFA European Under-17 Championship qualification

The 2023 UEFA European Under-17 Championship qualifying competition is a men's under-17 football tournament that will determine the 15 teams that will join the automatically qualified hosts, Hungary, in the 2023 UEFA European Under-17 Championship final tournament.

Format

The qualifying competition consists of two rounds: the qualifying round and the elite round. The qualifying round will be played in autumn 2022, with the elite round following in spring 2023.

Tiebreakers

In the event of two or more teams being tied on points in a group, the following tiebreakers will be applied:

* Higher number of points obtained in the matches played among the teams in question
* Superior goal difference resulting from the matches played among the teams in question
* Higher number of goals scored in the matches played among the teams in question
* If, after having applied the above criteria, two teams still have an equal ranking, the same criteria will be reapplied to determine the final ranking of these two teams. If this procedure does not lead to a decision, the following criteria will be applied:
	+ Superior goal difference in all group matches
	+ Higher number of goals scored in all group matches
	+ Drawing of lots by the UEFA administration

Qualifying round

The qualifying round will feature 54 teams divided into 13 groups of four teams each. Each group will be played in a single round-robin format, with the team that hosts the group being predetermined by UEFA. The 13 group winners, the 13 runners-up, and the four best third-placed teams will advance to the elite round.

Draw

The draw for the qualifying round was held on 18 December 2021 at the UEFA headquarters in Nyon, Switzerland.

* Higher number of points obtained in the matches played among the teams in question

* Higher number of goals scored in the matches played among the teams in question
* Drawing of lots by the UEFA administration

Elite round

The elite round will feature the 32 teams that advanced from the qualifying round, divided into eight groups of four teams each. Each group will be played in a single round-robin format, with the team that hosts the group being predetermined by UEFA. The eight group winners and the seven best runners-up will qualify for the final tournament.

The 2023 Atlantic hurricane season was an ongoing event in the annual cycle of tropical cyclone formation in the Atlantic Ocean. The season began on June 1, 2023, and will end on November 30, 2023. This article documents the storms that formed during the season, as well as their effects on population centers and the environment.

# Seasonal Forecasts

## Pre-season forecasts

Prior to the start of the 2023 Atlantic hurricane season, several organizations issued forecasts predicting the number of named storms, hurricanes, and major hurricanes that would occur during the season. These forecasts were based on various climate signals, including the El Niño-Southern Oscillation (ENSO), the North Atlantic Oscillation (NAO), and the Madden-Julian Oscillation (MJO).

In April 2023, the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) predicted a near-normal to above-normal season, with 12-17 named storms, 5-9 hurricanes, and 2-4 major hurricanes. The Climate Prediction Center (CPC) also issued a forecast in April, predicting a 40% chance of a near-normal season, a 30% chance of an above-normal season, and a 30% chance of a below-normal season.

## Mid-season forecasts

2023 Al Haouz Earthquake

The 2023 Al Haouz earthquake was a devastating seismic event that struck the Al Haouz Province in Morocco on September 8, 2023. The earthquake had a significant impact on the region, causing widespread destruction, loss of life, and displacement of people. This article provides an overview of the tectonic setting, the earthquake itself, the damage and casualties, the search and rescue efforts, the international response, and the recovery and assistance efforts.

# Tectonic setting

The Al Haouz Province is located in the High Atlas Mountains, a region of significant tectonic activity. The area is situated near the boundary between the Eurasian and African tectonic plates, which have been interacting for millions of years. This interaction has resulted in the formation of several major fault lines, including the Atlas Fault, which runs through the province. The Atlas Fault is a transform fault that accommodates the movement between the two plates, resulting in a high level of seismic activity in the region.

# Earthquake

## Mechanism

The 2023 Al Haouz earthquake was a shallow, crustal earthquake with a focal depth of approximately 10 km. The earthquake had a magnitude of 6.8 on the moment magnitude scale, making it one of the largest earthquakes to strike the region in recent years. The earthquake was caused by a sudden release of stress along the Atlas Fault, resulting in a significant amount of energy being released in the form of seismic waves.

## Ground effects

The earthquake caused widespread ground shaking, with reports of strong shaking felt as far away as Marrakech and Fez. The shaking was particularly intense in the Al Haouz Province, where buildings, roads, and other infrastructure were severely damaged. The earthquake also triggered several landslides and rockfalls, which further exacerbated the damage.

# Damage and casualties

The 2023 Al Haouz earthquake caused significant damage and loss of life. According to official reports, at least 2,000 people were killed, with many more injured. The earthquake also left thousands of people homeless, with many more affected by the destruction of infrastructure and buildings. The damage was particularly severe in rural areas, where many villages were completely destroyed.

# Search and rescue

Search and rescue efforts were launched immediately after the earthquake, with teams from the Moroccan government, as well as international organizations, working to locate and rescue those trapped under the rubble. The search and rescue efforts were hampered by the remote location of the affected areas, as well as the lack of adequate infrastructure. Despite these challenges, the search and rescue teams were able to locate and rescue many people, including those trapped in collapsed buildings.

# International response

The international community responded quickly to the disaster, with many countries offering aid and assistance to Morocco. The United Nations, the European Union, and other international organizations provided financial and material support, including food, shelter, and medical supplies. Many countries also sent search and rescue teams to assist in the rescue efforts.

# Recovery and assistance

The recovery and assistance efforts were led by the Moroccan government, with support from the international community. The government established a relief fund to support those affected by the earthquake, as well as a reconstruction plan to rebuild damaged infrastructure and buildings. The international community provided significant financial and material support to the recovery efforts, including funding for the reconstruction of schools, hospitals, and other critical infrastructure.

# Aid and crisis management

## International aid

The international community provided significant aid to Morocco in response to the earthquake. The aid included financial support, as well as material supplies, such as food, shelter, and medical equipment. Many countries also sent teams to assist in the search and rescue efforts, as well as to provide support for the recovery and reconstruction efforts.

## Crisis management

The Moroccan government established a crisis management team to coordinate the response to the earthquake. The team worked to assess the damage, identify areas of need, and allocate resources to support the recovery efforts. The team also worked to coordinate the international response, including the distribution of aid and the deployment of search and rescue teams.

## Protests

There were reports of protests in the aftermath of the earthquake, with many people expressing frustration with the government's response to the disaster. The protests were largely peaceful, but they highlighted the challenges facing the government in responding to the disaster.

## Reconstruction

The reconstruction efforts were led by the Moroccan government, with support from the international community. The government established a reconstruction plan, which included funding for the rebuilding of damaged infrastructure, as well as support for those affected by the earthquake. The plan also included measures to reduce the risk of future earthquakes, such as the implementation of building codes and the establishment of early warning systems.

article:
The Papers of Benjamin Franklin

Benjamin Franklin (1706-1790) was a leading figure in American history, renowned for his contributions to politics, science, literature, and diplomacy. Throughout his long and distinguished career, Franklin was a prolific writer, producing a vast array of letters, essays, articles, and other documents that provide valuable insights into his thoughts, experiences, and achievements. The Papers of Benjamin Franklin is a comprehensive collection of his writings, compiled and published by the American Philosophical Society (APS) and Yale University. This article provides an overview of the provenance, publication, and contents of the Papers, as well as selected writings and other relevant information.

# Provenance

The Papers of Benjamin Franklin originated from various sources, including Franklin's personal papers, letters, and manuscripts, as well as documents from archives and libraries around the world. Many of these materials were collected by Franklin's family members, friends, and associates, who recognized the importance of preserving his writings for posterity. In the late 19th century, the APS and Yale University began to acquire and compile these materials, with the goal of creating a definitive edition of Franklin's papers.

# APS and Yale publication

The APS and Yale University collaborated on the publication of The Papers of Benjamin Franklin, a multi-volume series that aimed to present a comprehensive and accurate representation of Franklin's writings. The project involved a team of editors, scholars, and researchers who worked tirelessly to transcribe, annotate, and contextualize Franklin's papers.

## Yale collection

The Yale University Library acquired a significant portion of Franklin's papers in the late 19th century, including his personal correspondence, scientific papers, and literary works. The Yale collection served as the foundation for the Papers project, providing a rich source of materials for the editors to work with.

## APS collection

The APS also contributed a substantial collection of Franklin's papers, including documents related to his scientific experiments, philosophical writings, and diplomatic activities. The APS collection complemented the Yale materials, providing a broader perspective on Franklin's life and work.

## Other collections

In addition to the APS and Yale collections, the Papers project drew on materials from other archives and libraries, including the Library of Congress, the British Library, and the Archives Nationales de France. These collections provided valuable insights into Franklin's international connections and activities, as well as his relationships with other prominent figures of the time.

# Selected writings

The Papers of Benjamin Franklin includes a vast array of writings, covering topics such as politics, science, literature, and philosophy. Some of the most notable selections include:

* The Autobiography of Benjamin Franklin, a celebrated work that provides a detailed and engaging account of Franklin's life and experiences.
* The Pennsylvania Gazette, a newspaper that Franklin edited and published, featuring articles, essays, and news from the American colonies.
* The Silence Dogood essays, a series of witty and satirical pieces that Franklin wrote under a pseudonym, critiquing social and cultural norms in colonial America.
* The Electrical Experiments, a collection of scientific papers that document Franklin's groundbreaking research on electricity and its properties.

# See also

* Silence Dogood essays
* Electrical Experiments

# Notes

The Papers of Benjamin Franklin is a monumental work that has shed new light on the life and writings of one of America's most beloved figures. The project has been praised for its meticulous scholarship, comprehensive coverage, and engaging presentation.

Ayutthaya Kingdom

The Ayutthaya Kingdom was a powerful and influential kingdom in Southeast Asia that existed from the 14th to the 18th century. Located in present-day Thailand, the kingdom was a major center of trade, culture, and politics in the region. At its peak, the Ayutthaya Kingdom was a vast empire that controlled much of present-day Thailand, as well as parts of modern-day Laos, Cambodia, and Myanmar.

# History

## Origins

The Ayutthaya Kingdom was founded in 1350 by King Ramathibodi I, who is said to have established the city of Ayutthaya as the capital. However, the origins of the kingdom are more complex, and the city of Ayutthaya was likely founded earlier.

Before the founding of Ayutthaya, there were several other cities in the region that played important roles in the development of the kingdom. One of these cities was Lopburi, which was an important center of trade and culture in the 13th century. Another city was Chaiya, which was the capital of the Srivijaya kingdom, a powerful maritime empire that controlled much of Southeast Asia.

According to legend, King Ramathibodi I founded the city of Ayutthaya in 1350 after a dream in which he was told to build a city at the confluence of the Chao Phraya, Pa Sak, and Lopburi rivers. The king is said to have named the city after the ancient Indian city of Ayodhya, which was the birthplace of the Hindu god Rama.

In the 14th and 15th centuries, the Ayutthaya Kingdom was a major maritime power, controlling much of the trade in Southeast Asia. 2022–23 UEFA Champions League

The 2022–23 UEFA Champions League is the 68th season of Europe's premier club football tournament, and the 31st season since it was rebranded from the European Cup to the UEFA Champions League.

# Association team allocation

For the 2022–23 UEFA Champions League, the associations were allocated places according to their UEFA country coefficients, which took into account their performance in European competitions from 2016–17 to 2020–21.

Forbidden Door (2023)
======================

Forbidden Door was a professional wrestling pay-per-view (PPV) event produced by New Japan Pro-Wrestling (NJPW) and All Elite Wrestling (AEW). The event took place on June 25, 2023, at the Scotiabank Arena in Toronto, Ontario, Canada. This marked the second edition of the Forbidden Door event, following the inaugural event in 2022.

Production
----------

### Background

The Forbidden Door event was first announced in November 2022, with NJPW and AEW confirming their partnership for the second consecutive year. The event aimed to bring together wrestlers from both promotions, creating unique match-ups and storylines. The name "Forbidden Door" symbolizes the opening of doors between the two promotions, allowing wrestlers to compete across borders.

### Storylines

The event featured a mix of championship matches, number one contender matches, and dream matches. The main storyline revolved around the IWGP United States Heavyweight Championship, with the winner earning a shot at the title. Other notable storylines included the rivalry between AEW's FTR and NJPW's United Empire, as well as the debut of several NJPW wrestlers in AEW.

Event
------

### Zero Hour

The Zero Hour pre-show featured a tag team match between AEW's Best Friends (Orange Cassidy and Trent Beretta) and NJPW's Roppongi Vice (Trent Beretta and Rocky Romero). The match was won by Best Friends, setting the tone for the rest of the event.

### Preliminary matches

The main card began with a six-man tag team match between AEW's The Young Bucks (Matt Jackson and Nick Jackson) and NJPW's Los Ingobernables de Japon (Tetsuya Naito, Sanada, and Bushi). The match showcased the high-flying abilities of both teams, with The Young Bucks emerging victorious.

The next match saw AEW's Thunder Rosa face off against NJPW's Willow Nightingale in a singles match. Rosa's experience and skill ultimately led to her victory, as she submitted Nightingale to the Peruvian Necktie.

The IWGP United States Heavyweight Championship number one contender tournament semi-finals took place next, with AEW's Samoa Joe facing off against NJPW's Tomohiro Ishii. Joe's brute strength and submission skills earned him the win, as he advanced to the tournament finals.

### Main event

The main event of the evening saw AEW's FTR (Cash Wheeler and Dax Harwood) face off against NJPW's United Empire (Kyle Fletcher and Mark Davis) in a tag team match for the IWGP Tag Team Championship. The match showcased the technical grappling skills of both teams, with FTR ultimately emerging victorious to become the new IWGP Tag Team Champions.

Reception
----------

The event received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the unique match-ups and storyline developments. The event's attendance of over 15,000 fans at the Scotiabank Arena marked a significant milestone for both NJPW and AEW.

Acharya (2022 film)

Acharya is a 2022 Indian Telugu-language action drama film written and directed by Koratala Siva. The film stars Chiranjeevi, Ram Charan, and Pooja Hegde in the lead roles, with Sonu Sood, Saurav Lokesh, and Kishore playing supporting roles. The film's music is composed by Mani Sharma, while the cinematography is handled by Thirunavukarasu.

# Plot

The film is set in the fictional town of Dharmasthali, which is under the control of a ruthless industrialist named Basava (Sonu Sood). Basava has been exploiting the town's natural resources for his own gain, leaving the residents in poverty and misery. The town's revered guru, Acharya (Chiranjeevi), has been fighting against Basava's tyranny, but his efforts have been in vain.

Enter Siddha (Ram Charan), a former student of Acharya who has been away from the town for many years. Siddha is a skilled fighter and a passionate activist who is determined to take down Basava and free the town from his clutches. As Siddha begins his mission, he is aided by Acharya and a local woman named Neelambari (Pooja Hegde).

As the story unfolds, Siddha and Acharya's efforts to take down Basava become increasingly successful, but they also attract the attention of the police and other powerful forces. The film's climax features a thrilling showdown between Siddha and Basava, with the fate of Dharmasthali hanging in the balance.

# Cast

* Chiranjeevi as Acharya
* Ram Charan as Siddha
* Pooja Hegde as Neelambari
* Sonu Sood as Basava
* Saurav Lokesh as Rudra
* Kishore as Pasupathi

# Production

## Development

Acharya was first announced in 2019, with Koratala Siva set to direct and Chiranjeevi starring in the lead role. The film was initially titled "Acharya: O Popeye," but the title was later shortened to simply "Acharya."

In an interview, Siva revealed that he had written the script for Acharya several years ago, but had been waiting for the right opportunity to make the film. He stated that he was inspired by the real-life struggles of the people of India, particularly in the rural areas, and wanted to make a film that would highlight their issues and inspire change.

## Casting

Ram Charan was cast in the role of Siddha, the film's male lead, in 2020. Charan had previously worked with Siva on the 2016 film "Dhruva," and the two had developed a close relationship.

Pooja Hegde was cast as Neelambari, the film's female lead, in 2020. Hegde had previously appeared in several Telugu films, including "Aravinda Sametha Veera Raghava" and "Gaddalakonda Ganesh."

Sonu Sood was cast as Basava, the film's main antagonist, in 2020. Sood had previously appeared in several Telugu films, including "Bruce Lee" and "Sarrainodu."

## Filming

Principal photography for Acharya began in January 2020, with the film's crew shooting on location in various parts of Telangana. The film's cinematography was handled by Thirunavukarasu, who had previously worked on several Telugu films, including "Geetha Govindam" and "Sye Raa Narasimha Reddy."

In an interview, Siva revealed that he had planned to wrap up filming within six months, but the COVID-19 pandemic had caused significant delays. He stated that the film's crew had to work under strict safety protocols to minimize the risk of infection.

## Legal issues

In 2021, the film's producers were sued by a Hyderabad-based writer named Rajesh Manduri, who claimed that the film's script had been plagiarized from his own work. The court ruled in favor of the producers, stating that there was no evidence to support Manduri's claims.

# Music

The film's music is composed by Mani Sharma, who has previously worked on several Telugu films, including "Sye Raa Narasimha Reddy" and "Gaddalakonda Ganesh." The film's soundtrack features five songs, including the hit single "Lahe Lahe."

In an interview, Sharma revealed that he had been inspired by the film's script and had composed the music accordingly. He stated that he had used a mix of traditional and modern instruments to create a unique sound.

# Release

## Theatrical

Acharya was released theatrically on April 29, 2022, in Telangana and Andhra Pradesh. The film received a grand opening, with fans thronging theaters to catch a glimpse of their favorite stars.

In an interview, Siva revealed that he had been nervous about the film's release, but was thrilled with the response. He stated that he was grateful to the fans for their support and promised to make more films that would inspire and entertain them.

## Home media

Acharya was released on Amazon Prime Video on May 20, 2022, just three weeks after its theatrical release. The film's digital rights were acquired by Amazon Prime for a reported Rs 100 crore.

# Reception

## Box office

Acharya opened to a grand start at the box office, collecting over Rs 50 crore on its opening day. The film went on to collect over Rs 200 crore in its opening weekend, making it one of the highest-grossing Telugu films of 2022.

In an interview, Siva revealed that he was thrilled with the film's box office performance, but stated that he was more concerned about the film's impact on society. He stated that he hoped the film would inspire change and make a positive impact on the lives of the people.

## Critical response

Acharya received generally positive reviews from critics, with many praising the film's message, performances, and technical aspects. The film's cinematography, music, and action sequences were particularly praised.

However, some critics felt that the film's script was predictable and that the film's pacing was slow. They also felt that the film's villain was underdeveloped and that the film's climax was over-the-top.

Bhediya

Bhediya is a 2022 Indian Hindi-language comedy horror film directed by Amar Kaushik and produced by Dinesh Vijan. The film stars Varun Dhawan and Kriti Sanon in the lead roles, with Deepak Dobriyal, Abhishek Banerjee, and Paalin Kabak in supporting roles. Bhediya is the third installment in Dinesh Vijan's horror-comedy universe, following Stree (2018) and Roohi (2021).

#Plot

Bhediya is set in the fictional town of Ziro, Arunachal Pradesh, and follows the story of Bhaskar, a road construction contractor who arrives in the town with his cousin Janardan to work on a project. Bhaskar is a skeptic who does not believe in the supernatural, but his life takes a turn when he is bitten by a wolf while on a trek. As the full moon approaches, Bhaskar begins to experience strange transformations, and he soon discovers that he has become a werewolf.

As Bhaskar struggles to control his newfound condition, he seeks the help of a veterinarian, Dr. Anika, who is initially hesitant to believe his story. However, as the full moon rises, Bhaskar transforms into a wolf, and Anika is forced to confront the reality of the situation. Together, they embark on a journey to find a cure for Bhaskar's condition, while also facing threats from a group of hunters who are determined to capture the werewolf.

#Reception

The film's performances, particularly those of Varun Dhawan and Kriti Sanon, were also praised. However, some critics felt that the film's pacing was uneven, and that the story could have been more developed.

##Box office

article:
Russo-Ukrainian War
=====================

The Russo-Ukrainian War is an ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine that began in 2014. The conflict has its roots in the country's complex history, cultural divisions, and geopolitical tensions. The war has resulted in significant human suffering, economic losses, and a substantial impact on international relations.

Background
==========

### Independent Ukraine and the Orange Revolution

Ukraine gained independence from the Soviet Union in 1991. The country's early years were marked by political instability, economic struggles, and a deepening divide between the pro-Russian eastern regions and the pro-European western regions. The Orange Revolution in 2004, which saw the ousting of President Leonid Kuchma, was a significant turning point in Ukraine's history. The revolution led to the election of President Viktor Yushchenko, who sought to strengthen ties with Europe and reduce Russian influence.

### Euromaidan, Revolution of Dignity, and pro-Russian unrest

In 2013, Ukraine's President Viktor Yanukovych suspended plans to sign an association agreement with the European Union, sparking widespread protests in Kyiv's Independence Square, known as the Euromaidan. The protests, which became known as the Revolution of Dignity, demanded greater European integration and an end to corruption. The protests eventually led to Yanukovych's ousting in February 2014.

In the aftermath of the revolution, pro-Russian unrest broke out in eastern Ukraine, particularly in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions. The unrest was fueled by concerns among the predominantly Russian-speaking population about the new government's intentions and the potential loss of Russian influence.

### Russian military bases in Crimea

Russia has maintained a significant military presence in Crimea since the 1990s, when Ukraine and Russia signed a treaty allowing Russia to lease the Sevastopol naval base. The base was home to Russia's Black Sea Fleet, and its presence was seen as a key factor in Russia's ability to project power in the region.

### Legality and declaration of war

The conflict between Russia and Ukraine has raised significant questions about the legality of Russia's actions. Ukraine and many Western countries have accused Russia of violating international law, including the United Nations Charter and the Budapest Memorandum, which guaranteed Ukraine's sovereignty and territorial integrity.

History
=======

### Russian annexation of Crimea (2014)

In February 2014, following the ousting of President Yanukovych, Russian troops began to deploy in Crimea. The troops, who wore uniforms without insignia, quickly took control of key infrastructure, including airports and government buildings. A referendum was held on March 16, in which the majority of Crimean voters supported joining Russia. The annexation was widely condemned by the international community, and Ukraine, the United States, and the European Union imposed economic sanctions on Russia.

### War in the Donbas (2014–2015)

#### Pro-Russia unrest

In April 2014, pro-Russian unrest broke out in the Donetsk and Luhansk regions, with protesters demanding greater autonomy or independence from Ukraine. The unrest quickly escalated into armed conflict, with the formation of the Donetsk People's Republic (DPR) and the Luhansk People's Republic (LPR).

#### Armed conflict

The conflict in the Donbas region was marked by intense fighting between Ukrainian government forces and the separatist militias. The conflict resulted in significant human suffering, with thousands of civilians killed or displaced.

#### August 2014 Russian invasion

In August 2014, Russian troops crossed the border into Ukraine, marking the beginning of a full-scale invasion. The invasion was widely condemned by the international community, and Ukraine, the United States, and the European Union imposed further economic sanctions on Russia.

#### Mariupol offensive and first Minsk ceasefire

In September 2014, Ukrainian government forces launched an offensive to retake the city of Mariupol, which had been captured by the separatists. The offensive was successful, but it was followed by a ceasefire agreement, known as the Minsk Protocol, which was signed on September 5. The ceasefire was brokered by the Organization for Security and Co-operation in Europe (OSCE) and was intended to bring an end to the conflict.

#### End of 2014 and Minsk II agreement

The ceasefire agreement was short-lived, and fighting resumed in the Donbas region. In February 2015, a new ceasefire agreement, known as the Minsk II agreement, was signed. The agreement established a buffer zone between Ukrainian government forces and the separatist militias and called for the withdrawal of heavy artillery.

### Line of conflict stabilizes (2015–2022)

The conflict in the Donbas region continued at a lower intensity, with periodic outbreaks of fighting. The line of conflict stabilized, with Ukrainian government forces and the separatist militias dug in along a 400-kilometer front line.

#### 2018 Kerch Strait incident

In November 2018, a confrontation between Ukrainian and Russian naval vessels in the Kerch Strait resulted in the capture of three Ukrainian ships and the detention of 24 Ukrainian sailors. The incident was widely condemned by the international community, and Ukraine imposed martial law in response.

#### 2019–2020

The conflict in the Donbas region continued at a low intensity, with periodic outbreaks of fighting. In 2019, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelensky was elected on a platform of ending the conflict, but progress was slow.

### Full-scale Russian invasion of Ukraine (2022)

#### Prelude

In the months leading up to the invasion, Russia amassed a significant military presence along the border with Ukraine. The buildup was accompanied by a propaganda campaign, which portrayed Ukraine as a threat to Russian security.

#### Escalation

On February 24, 2022, Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine, with missile strikes and ground attacks on multiple fronts. The invasion was widely condemned by the international community, and Ukraine, the United States, and the European Union imposed significant economic sanctions on Russia.

#### Full-scale invasion

The invasion was marked by intense fighting, with Ukrainian government forces resisting the Russian advance. The conflict resulted in significant human suffering, with thousands of civilians killed or displaced.

### Ukrainian counteroffensives and stalemate (2022–2023)

In the months following the invasion, Ukrainian government forces launched a series of counteroffensives, which pushed the Russian military back in several key areas. The conflict stabilized, with both sides dug in along a 1,000-kilometer front line.

### Russian campaigns and Ukrainian Kursk offensive (1 December 2023 – present)

In December 2023, Russian forces launched a series of campaigns, which aimed to capture key cities and infrastructure. The campaigns were met with fierce resistance from Ukrainian government forces, who launched a counteroffensive in the Kursk region.

Human rights violations
=====================

The conflict in Ukraine has been marked by significant human rights violations, including the use of torture, forced conscription, and the targeting of civilians. The conflict has also resulted in significant displacement, with millions of people forced to flee their homes.

Related issues
==============

### Spillover

The conflict in Ukraine has had significant spillover effects, including the displacement of people to neighboring countries and the impact on regional stability.

### Gas disputes and Nord Stream sabotage

The conflict in Ukraine has been accompanied by disputes over gas supplies, with Russia accused of using energy as a tool of coercion. In 2022, the Nord Stream pipeline was sabotaged, resulting in significant environmental damage.

### Hybrid warfare

The conflict in Ukraine has been marked by the use of hybrid warfare tactics, including cyber attacks, disinformation campaigns, and the use of proxy forces.

### Russian propaganda and disinformation campaigns

Russia has been accused of using propaganda and disinformation campaigns to shape public opinion and influence the narrative around the conflict.

### Role of the Russian Orthodox Church in Ukraine

The Russian Orthodox Church has played a significant role in the conflict in Ukraine, with some clergy accused of supporting the separatist militias.

### Russia–NATO relations

The conflict in Ukraine has had significant implications for Russia–NATO relations, with tensions between the two sides at a post-Cold War high.

Reactions
=========

### Reactions to the Russian annexation of Crimea

#### Ukrainian response

Ukraine condemned the annexation of Crimea, with President Oleksandr Turchynov describing it as a "gross violation of international law."

#### NATO and United States military response

NATO and the United States condemned the annexation, with NATO Secretary-General Anders Fogh Rasmussen describing it as a "sovereign rights violation."

#### Financial markets

The annexation had significant implications for financial markets, with the Russian stock market falling by 10%.

### Reactions to the war in Donbas

#### Ukrainian public opinion

Ukrainian public opinion has been strongly opposed to the conflict, with many Ukrainians viewing the separatist militias as Russian proxies.

#### Russian public opinion

Russian public opinion has been strongly supportive of the conflict, with many Russians viewing the Ukrainian government as illegitimate.

### Reactions to the Russian invasion of Ukraine

#### Ukrainian public opinion

Ukrainian public opinion has been strongly opposed to the invasion, with many Ukrainians viewing it as an act of aggression.

#### Russian public opinion

Russian public opinion has been strongly supportive of the invasion, with many Russians viewing it as a necessary measure to protect Russian security.

#### United States

The United States has condemned the invasion, with President Joe Biden describing it as a "brazen attack on the territorial integrity of Ukraine."

#### Russian military suppliers

Several countries have imposed sanctions on Russian military suppliers, including the United States, the European Union, and the United Kingdom.

#### United Nations

The United Nations has condemned the invasion, with Secretary-General António Guterres describing it as a "violation of the United Nations Charter."

* 2022 Russian invasion of Ukraine

article:
2022 West Java Earthquake

The 2022 West Java earthquake occurred on November 21, 2022, at 13:21 local time, with its epicenter located in the Cianjur Regency, West Java Province, Indonesia. The earthquake had a magnitude of 5.6 on the Richter scale, with a depth of 10 kilometers (6.2 miles). The disaster caused widespread destruction, loss of life, and displacement of people in the affected areas.

#Tectonic setting

Indonesia is a seismically active region, located at the boundary between the Eurasian and Australian tectonic plates. The country is part of the Pacific Ring of Fire, which is an area prone to earthquakes and volcanic eruptions. The western part of Java Island, where the earthquake occurred, is an area of high seismic activity due to the subduction of the Australian plate beneath the Eurasian plate. The subduction process is responsible for the formation of the Java Trench, a deep-sea trench located south of the island.

The region around Cianjur is characterized by a complex geological structure, with multiple faults and fractures that can produce earthquakes. The area is also home to several active volcanoes, including Mount Gede and Mount Salak, which are located to the northwest and west of the epicenter, respectively. The volcanic activity in the region is a result of the subduction process, which causes the Earth's crust to melt and produce magma.

#Earthquake

The 2022 West Java earthquake had a magnitude of 5.6 on the Richter scale, with a depth of 10 kilometers (6.2 miles). The earthquake was a shallow one, which meant that the seismic energy was released close to the surface, resulting in more damage and loss of life. The epicenter of the earthquake was located in the Cianjur Regency, approximately 10 kilometers (6.2 miles) southwest of the city of Cianjur.

The earthquake was a result of a thrust faulting mechanism, which occurs when one plate is pushed beneath another. In this case, the Australian plate was pushed beneath the Eurasian plate, resulting in the release of seismic energy. The earthquake was characterized by a series of aftershocks, with the largest one having a magnitude of 3.6 on the Richter scale.

#Impact

The 2022 West Java earthquake had a significant impact on the affected areas. The earthquake caused widespread destruction, with many buildings, including homes, schools, and hospitals, collapsing or suffering significant damage. The disaster also caused landslides and soil liquefaction, which further exacerbated the damage.

The earthquake also caused a power outage in the affected areas, with many residents left without electricity or communication services. The disaster also disrupted transportation services, with many roads and highways closed due to damage or landslides.

#Casualties

The 2022 West Java earthquake resulted in a significant loss of life, with over 600 people confirmed dead. Many more were injured, with over 1,000 people treated in hospitals for their injuries. The disaster also caused widespread displacement, with many people left without homes or access to basic necessities.

##Search and rescue

The search and rescue efforts were led by the Indonesian National Disaster Management Agency (BNPB), with assistance from local authorities, emergency services, and international organizations. The rescue efforts were hampered by the remote location of the affected areas and the lack of access to the area due to damage to roads and infrastructure.

The rescue teams worked tirelessly to search for survivors, with many people trapped under rubble or debris. The rescue efforts were also assisted by sniffer dogs, which were used to locate survivors and recover bodies.

#Aftermath

The aftermath of the 2022 West Java earthquake saw a significant response from the Indonesian government and international organizations. The government declared a state of emergency in the affected areas, with military personnel deployed to assist with the relief efforts.

##Reconstruction

The reconstruction efforts are ongoing, with the Indonesian government committing to rebuilding the affected areas. The government has pledged to provide assistance to those affected by the disaster, including financial support and housing assistance.

The reconstruction efforts are being led by the Indonesian government, with assistance from international organizations and non-governmental organizations. The efforts are focused on rebuilding homes, schools, and hospitals, as well as restoring basic infrastructure such as roads, bridges, and utilities.

#Response

The response to the 2022 West Java earthquake was swift, with the Indonesian government and international organizations providing assistance to the affected areas.

##International aid

The international community provided significant assistance to the affected areas, with many countries pledging aid and support. The aid included financial assistance, food, shelter, and medical supplies.

The United Nations (UN) played a significant role in the response efforts, with the UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA) coordinating the international response. The UN also provided funding and resources to support the relief efforts.

#Controversy

The response to the 2022 West Java earthquake was not without controversy, with some critics arguing that the Indonesian government was slow to respond to the disaster. Others argued that the government's response was inadequate, with many people left without access to basic necessities.

There were also concerns about the distribution of aid, with some reports suggesting that aid was not reaching those who needed it most. The controversy surrounding the response efforts highlighted the need for more effective disaster management and response mechanisms in Indonesia.

article:
Tropical Storm Megi

Tropical Storm Megi was a tropical cyclone that affected the Philippines, Taiwan, and China in April 2010. The storm caused significant damage and loss of life in these countries, particularly in the Philippines where it made landfall. Megi was the third tropical storm of the 2010 Pacific typhoon season.

#Meteorological history

##Formation and intensification
Megi formed as a tropical depression on April 13, 2010, over the western Pacific Ocean, about 1,000 km (620 mi) east of the Philippines. The Japan Meteorological Agency (JMA) began monitoring the system as a tropical depression, while the Joint Typhoon Warning Center (JTWC) initiated advisories on the system as Tropical Depression 03W.

The depression slowly intensified as it moved westward, becoming a tropical storm on April 14, with the JMA assigning the name Megi. The JTWC followed suit, upgrading the system to a tropical storm. Megi continued to strengthen, reaching its peak intensity on April 17, with maximum sustained winds of 165 km/h (105 mph) and a minimum central pressure of 975 hPa (28.79 inHg).

##Landfall and weakening
Megi made landfall in the Philippines on April 18, specifically in the province of Isabela. The storm brought strong winds and heavy rainfall, causing widespread damage and power outages. After making landfall, Megi began to weaken, with its winds decreasing to 120 km/h (75 mph) and its pressure increasing to 985 hPa (29.09 inHg).

##Re-emergence and re-intensification
After crossing the Philippines, Megi re-emerged into the South China Sea, where it began to re-intensify. The JMA reported that Megi regained its strength, with maximum sustained winds of 150 km/h (90 mph) and a minimum central pressure of 980 hPa (28.94 inHg). However, the JTWC did not re-classify Megi as a tropical storm, instead maintaining its status as a tropical depression.

##Landfall in Taiwan and China
Megi made landfall in Taiwan on April 20, bringing strong winds and heavy rainfall to the island. The storm then moved into China, specifically in the province of Fujian, where it caused further damage and disruption.

##Dissipation
Megi dissipated on April 23, as it moved inland and encountered unfavorable weather conditions. The JMA and JTWC issued their final advisories on the system, marking the end of Megi's meteorological history.

#Preparations

##Philippines
The Philippine government took proactive measures to prepare for Megi's landfall. The National Disaster Risk Reduction and Management Council (NDRRMC) activated its emergency response protocols, deploying personnel and equipment to affected areas. The Philippine Atmospheric, Geophysical and Astronomical Services Administration (PAGASA) issued public storm warning signals, advising residents of the potential dangers posed by the storm.

##Taiwan
The Taiwanese government also took steps to prepare for Megi's landfall. The Central Weather Bureau (CWB) issued storm warnings, advising residents of the potential impacts of the storm. The Ministry of the Interior activated its emergency response protocols, deploying personnel and equipment to affected areas.

##China
The Chinese government prepared for Megi's landfall by activating its emergency response protocols. The National Meteorological Center (NMC) issued storm warnings, advising residents of the potential impacts of the storm. The Ministry of Civil Affairs deployed personnel and equipment to affected areas.

#Impact

##Philippines
Megi caused significant damage and loss of life in the Philippines. The storm brought strong winds and heavy rainfall, causing widespread power outages and damage to infrastructure. According to official reports, Megi caused 32 deaths and 2,500 injuries, with over 200,000 people displaced. The storm also caused significant damage to agriculture, with estimated losses of PHP 2.5 billion (USD 50 million).

##Taiwan
Megi caused significant damage and disruption in Taiwan. The storm brought strong winds and heavy rainfall, causing widespread power outages and damage to infrastructure. According to official reports, Megi caused 5 deaths and 200 injuries, with over 10,000 people displaced. The storm also caused significant damage to agriculture, with estimated losses of TWD 1.5 billion (USD 50 million).

##China
Megi caused significant damage and disruption in China. The storm brought strong winds and heavy rainfall, causing widespread power outages and damage to infrastructure. According to official reports, Megi caused 10 deaths and 500 injuries, with over 50,000 people displaced. The storm also caused significant damage to agriculture, with estimated losses of CNY 1.5 billion (USD 220 million).

#Aftermath

##Relief efforts
The Philippine government launched relief efforts to assist affected communities. The NDRRMC coordinated the distribution of food, water, and shelter to displaced persons. The Philippine Red Cross also participated in relief efforts, providing medical assistance and shelter to affected communities.

##Reconstruction efforts
The Philippine government initiated reconstruction efforts to repair damaged infrastructure. The Department of Public Works and Highways (DPWH) began repairing roads and bridges, while the National Electrification Administration (NEA) worked to restore power lines.

##Economic impact
Megi had a significant economic impact on the Philippines, Taiwan, and China. The storm caused widespread damage to agriculture, infrastructure, and industry, resulting in estimated losses of over USD 1 billion.

#Retirement

The name "Megi" was retired from the list of names for tropical cyclones in the western Pacific Ocean. The World Meteorological Organization (WMO) retired the name due to the significant damage and loss of life caused by the storm.

article:
Oliver Anthony
================

Oliver Anthony is an American singer-songwriter and musician known for his unique blend of country, blues, and folk music. With a distinctive voice and style, Anthony has built a loyal following and critical acclaim for his raw, emotive, and often provocative songs.

Career
--------

### Career beginnings

Oliver Anthony's music career began in the mid-2010s, with early performances at local bars and clubs in his hometown. Initially playing solo, Anthony eventually formed a band to accompany him on stage and in the studio. His early sound was marked by a strong country influence, drawing on the traditions of artists like Hank Williams and Johnny Cash.

### "Rich Men North of Richmond"

In 2018, Anthony released his breakthrough single, "Rich Men North of Richmond," a scathing critique of wealth inequality and social injustice. The song's raw energy and unflinching lyrics resonated with listeners, quickly gaining attention from music bloggers and critics. "Rich Men North of Richmond" became an anthem for those disillusioned with the status quo, cementing Anthony's reputation as a fearless and uncompromising songwriter.

### Later output

Following the success of "Rich Men North of Richmond," Anthony continued to release music that pushed the boundaries of traditional country and folk. His subsequent singles and albums explored themes of love, loss, and social commentary, often incorporating elements of blues and Americana. Anthony's music has been praised for its emotional intensity, poetic lyrics, and soaring melodies.

Firsts
--------

Oliver Anthony's music has been marked by several notable "firsts." He was one of the first artists to popularize the genre-bending sound that blends country, blues, and folk. Anthony's early adoption of social media platforms also helped him build a dedicated fan base, allowing him to connect directly with listeners and share his music with a wider audience.

Artistry
---------

Anthony's artistry is characterized by his unique voice, which has been described as both rugged and melodic. His songwriting is marked by a strong sense of storytelling, often drawing on personal experiences and observations. Anthony's music frequently incorporates elements of blues and Americana, reflecting his diverse musical influences.

Personal life
-------------

Oliver Anthony is known to be private about his personal life, preferring to focus on his music and artistic endeavors. However, he has been open about his struggles with mental health and addiction, using his platform to raise awareness and support for related causes.

Discography
------------

### Studio albums

* "The Long Way Home" (2020)
* "Blood and Bones" (2022)

### Singles

* "Rich Men North of Richmond" (2018)
* "Whiskey and Worn-Out Dreams" (2019)
* "The Devil's in the Details" (2020)
* "Ghosts of My Past" (2021)

Notes
-----

Oliver Anthony's music has been praised for its raw energy, poetic lyrics, and soaring melodies. With a distinctive voice and style, Anthony has built a loyal following and critical acclaim for his unique blend of country, blues, and folk music. As a singer-songwriter and musician, Anthony continues to push the boundaries of traditional genres, exploring themes of love, loss, and social commentary in his music.

article:
UAAP Season 85 basketball tournaments

The UAAP Season 85 basketball tournaments are the 85th season of the University Athletic Association of the Philippines (UAAP) basketball tournaments. The men's tournament, also known as the Seniors' division, is the top-tier basketball tournament of the UAAP, while the women's tournament is the top-tier women's basketball tournament. The boys' tournament, also known as the Juniors' division, is the top-tier high school basketball tournament of the UAAP.

#Tournament format

The tournament format for the men's and women's tournaments is a double round-robin elimination, where each team plays every other team twice. The top four teams in each tournament qualify for the semifinals, with the top two teams earning a twice-to-beat advantage. The semifinals are a best-of-three series, with the winners advancing to the best-of-three Finals. The boys' tournament follows a similar format, but with a single round-robin elimination round.

#Teams

The following teams participated in the UAAP Season 85 basketball tournaments:

Men's tournament:

* Adamson Soaring Falcons
* Ateneo Blue Eagles
* De La Salle Green Archers
* FEU Tamaraws
* NU Bulldogs
* UE Red Warriors
* UP Fighting Maroons
* UST Growling Tigers

article:
118th United States Congress

The 118th United States Congress was a meeting of the legislative branch of the United States federal government, composed of the Senate and the House of Representatives. It convened in Washington, D.C. on January 3, 2023, and will end on January 3, 2025. The 118th Congress is the current Congress, and its members were elected in the 2022 elections.

Major Events

The 118th Congress has seen several significant events, including the continuation of the COVID-19 pandemic, the ongoing conflict in Ukraine, and the 2024 presidential election. Additionally, the Congress has been focused on addressing various domestic issues, such as the economy, healthcare, and climate change.

Major Legislation

### Enacted

Several notable pieces of legislation have been enacted during the 118th Congress, including:

* The Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023, which provided funding for the federal government through the remainder of fiscal year 2023
* The National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2023, which authorized funding for the military and defense-related programs
* The Bipartisan Safer Communities Act, which aimed to reduce gun violence through various measures, including expanded background checks and increased funding for mental health services

### Proposed (but not enacted)

Several notable pieces of legislation have been proposed but not enacted during the 118th Congress, including:

* The Build Back Better Act, a comprehensive bill aimed at addressing various domestic issues, including climate change, healthcare, and the economy
* The For the People Act, a voting rights bill aimed at expanding access to voting and reducing the influence of money in politics
* The Protecting the Right to Organize Act, a labor rights bill aimed at strengthening protections for workers and promoting collective bargaining

Major Resolutions

### Adopted

Several notable resolutions have been adopted during the 118th Congress, including:

* A resolution condemning the Russian invasion of Ukraine and expressing support for the Ukrainian people
* A resolution recognizing the importance of the National Park Service and promoting conservation efforts
* A resolution honoring the legacy of Martin Luther King Jr. and promoting civil rights and social justice

### Proposed

Several notable resolutions have been proposed but not adopted during the 118th Congress, including:

* A resolution calling for the impeachment of President Biden
* A resolution condemning the use of force by the Israeli government against Palestinian civilians
* A resolution promoting the use of renewable energy sources and reducing greenhouse gas emissions

### Vetoed

One notable resolution was vetoed by President Biden during the 118th Congress, including:

* A resolution disapproving of the administration's decision to end the COVID-19 national emergency

article:
Babylon (2022 film)

Babylon is a 2022 American epic drama film written and directed by Damien Chazelle. The film is set in 1920s Hollywood, during the transition from silent films to talkies, and explores the rise and fall of several characters in the film industry.

#Plot

The film takes place in 1926, during the height of the Roaring Twenties, and follows the interconnected lives of several characters in the film industry. The story centers around Jack Conrad (played by Brad Pitt), a fading silent film star struggling to adapt to the new world of talkies. Jack's life is marked by excess and decadence, and he finds himself at the center of a scandal that threatens to destroy his career.

Meanwhile, Manny Torres (played by Diego Calva), a young and ambitious Mexican immigrant, rises through the ranks of the film industry, becoming a key player in the transition to talkies. Manny's journey is marked by his own personal struggles, including his complicated relationships with his family and his identity as a Mexican immigrant in a predominantly white industry.

The film also follows the story of Nellie LaRoy (played by Margot Robbie), a young and ambitious actress who becomes a star of the new talkies. Nellie's rise to fame is marked by her fierce determination and her willingness to do whatever it takes to succeed, but she also struggles with the pressures of fame and the objectification of her body.

Throughout the film, these characters' lives intersect and collide, as they navigate the changing landscape of the film industry. Along the way, they must confront their own personal demons and the darker side of the Hollywood dream.

#Cast

The film features an ensemble cast, including:

* Brad Pitt as Jack Conrad, a fading silent film star
* Diego Calva as Manny Torres, a young and ambitious Mexican immigrant
* Margot Robbie as Nellie LaRoy, a young and ambitious actress
* Jovan Adepo as Sidney Palmer, a young and talented trumpet player
* Li Jun Li as Lady Fay Zhu, a Chinese actress and singer
* Jean Smart as Elinor St. John, a veteran actress and mentor to Nellie
* Olivia Wilde as Ina Conrad, Jack's wife and a former actress
* Spike Jonze as Otto von Strassberger, a German filmmaker and artist

#Production

##Development

Damien Chazelle began working on the script for Babylon in 2019, drawing inspiration from his own experiences in the film industry and his fascination with the history of Hollywood. Chazelle has stated that he was drawn to the idea of exploring the transition from silent films to talkies, and the ways in which this change affected the lives of those working in the industry.

##Filming

Principal photography on Babylon began in July 2021, with a budget of over $80 million. The film was shot on location in Los Angeles and surrounding areas, with additional filming taking place in Mexico City. Chazelle worked closely with his cast and crew to recreate the look and feel of 1920s Hollywood, using a combination of practical sets and visual effects.

##Music

The film's score was composed by Justin Hurwitz, who has collaborated with Chazelle on several previous projects. The score incorporates a range of musical styles, from jazz and blues to classical and pop. The film also features several original songs, performed by the cast and other artists.

#Themes

Babylon explores a range of themes, including the corrupting influence of power and fame, the tension between tradition and innovation, and the struggle for identity and belonging in a rapidly changing world. The film also touches on issues of racism and sexism, highlighting the ways in which these forms of oppression have been embedded in the film industry from its earliest days.

#Release

##Theatrical

Babylon was released in theaters on December 23, 2022, by Paramount Pictures. The film received a wide release, opening on over 3,000 screens in the United States and Canada.

##Home media

Babylon was released on digital platforms on March 21, 2023, and on DVD and Blu-ray on April 18, 2023.

##Marketing

The film's marketing campaign was led by Paramount Pictures, with a focus on highlighting the film's epic scope and its all-star cast. The campaign included a range of trailers and TV spots, as well as promotional partnerships with brands such as Apple and Dolby.

#Reception

##Box office

Babylon grossed over $63 million at the domestic box office and over $120 million worldwide, on a budget of over $80 million. While the film did not achieve major commercial success, it did receive critical acclaim and has since developed a cult following.

##Critical response

Babylon received widespread critical acclaim, with many praising the film's ambition, its performances, and its technical achievements. The film holds a 91% approval rating on Rotten Tomatoes, based on over 200 reviews, with an average rating of 8.1/10. On Metacritic, the film has a score of 84 out of 100, based on over 40 reviews, indicating "universal acclaim".

#Accolades

Babylon received several awards and nominations, including:

* Academy Awards: 3 nominations (Best Original Score, Best Production Design, Best Costume Design)
* Golden Globe Awards: 2 nominations (Best Motion Picture – Drama, Best Director)
* BAFTA Awards: 5 nominations (Best Film, Best Director, Best Original Screenplay, Best Cinematography, Best Production Design)

#See also

* The Artist (2011)
* La La Land (2016)
* Once Upon a Time in Hollywood (2019)
* Mank (2020)

#References

#External links
